And walk in the light!

fields.title: E9 - New Spring Recap: Spoilers and Theories Chapters 11 - 14
fields.description:
We did it again.  As much as we try to be brief when chatting over these chapters we just get lost in the Wheel of Time world and end up talking for hours.  We've trimmed it down, but there was just so much to still cover in those last four chapters that trimming this down too far felt a bit too challenging.    That said, we talk about Black Ajah, the life-span issues of an Aes Sedai queen, the sad way the Tower handles failure, and many other things that span across the full series.  

We also had a really fun interaction around a question we posed on Twitter about who has read New Spring, why or why not, and we just had to share a handful of the replies we received.  So much fun!  We love every interaction we get to have with fellow WoT fans. 

Next week we are back to covering just two chapters at a time and we have arrived in the Borderlands with Lan and Bukama!  These chapters were so beautifully written and so lively that it almost felt like reading a book from an entirely different series.  There are some saucy bar maids and deadly fighting taking place, but what else would you expect from the most dangerous place to live in the Westlands? Make sure to join us! 

Let us know what you thought of our content, correct us, send us things we may have missed to our email: roadtotarvalon@gmail.com You can find Amber on Twitter @Road to Tar Valon and Traci @MistressLaras, or Laras, Mistress of the Kitchens.  We are on Instagram, roadtotarvalon.  We would love it if you would subscribe to us on Spotify, Anchor, Apple podcast or anywhere else you listen.  You can find more information on our webpage, anchor.fm/roadtotarvalon.  And if you have the anchor app, you can leave us a voice message that we can use in upcoming episodes.  Just let us know in the message if that’s something you are comfortable with or not.

We have added one more avenue of communication with our new Discord server!  Send us an email or message Amber on IG or Twitter for the link.  We will have it added to our social media pages as soon as we can.  We received a ton of help from Cheyenne Sedai from the Weaves of the Wheel community.  Seriously could not have done this without her help.  Thank you so much! 

So until next week,

Thanks for joining us!

Safe travels!

And walk in the light!

fields.title: E8 - New Spring Recap Chapters 11 thru 14: Adventures Away!
fields.description:
Spoiler free recap!  We realized that maybe four chapters per episode was a bit much so we split up what we wanted to talk about into two episodes; this one being spoiler free and next week being more full of spoilers and theories.  Although, we did take a few minutes at the start of the episode to do a little theorizing around the direction the show might take when it comes to portraying Aes Sedai, but then it was back to the recap.  This week it’s chapters 11 - 14 and ooh, boy, it’s starting to get good!

We’re keeping things short and sweet this week, so if you want to reach out to us with any questions on our show, it’s all down below.

Let us know what you thought of our content, correct us, send us things we may have missed to our email: roadtotarvalon@gmail.com You can find Amber on Twitter @Road to Tar Valon and Traci @MistressLaras, or Laras, Mistress of the Kitchens.  There’s a story there, but we’ll get to that another time.  We are on Instagram, roadtotarvalon.  We would love it if you would subscribe to us on Spotify, Anchor, Apple podcast or anywhere else you listen.  You can find more information on our webpage, anchor.fm/roadtotarvalon.  And if you have the anchor app, you can leave us a voice message that we can use in upcoming episodes.  Just let us know in the message if that’s something you are comfortable with or not.

So until next week,

Thanks for joining us!

Safe travels!

And walk in the light!

fields.title: E7 - New Spring Recap: Chapters 7 thru 10: Siuan and Moiraine - Bestie Goals and Testing for the Shawl
fields.description:
We were maybe a little extra chatty this past episode, when you’re on a roll and talking about something you love...well, time flies!  We hope you enjoy this extra long episode.  We were feeling ambitious and possibly took on a bit too much but we are finding our stride and encourage you to take breaks as you need them while listening.  We do have this split into a beginning portion that is spoiler free and we will announce when the spoiler section is about to begin.

Before we launched into our recap this week we wanted to give some of our time to discuss the recent anniversary of Robert Jordan’s death and the impact he’s had on millions of lives.  A big thank you to Lauren at Unraveling the Pattern on YouTube for letting us use a sound clip from one of his amazing videos to really concisely sum up the truly epic series that has become Jordan’s legacy.

Chapters 7 & 8 lead us through more of Siuan’s and Moiraine’s path to earning the much coveted shawl of an Aes Sedai and chapters 9 & 10 have us going through the test to become an Aes Sedai for the first time in the series.  It’s both terrifying and delightful.

We wrap up this episode with some of our own theories as to why things are happening the way they are and where some of these things lead us to later in the series.  If you haven’t read the full series, this is where we should really part ways.  We wouldn’t want to ruin anything for you!

This episode was recorded a week ahead of schedule so there is a correction to be made.  Traci’s Twitter handle has been changed to @MistressLaras and she’s happily chatting about books and food, among other things, with some truly amazing people.  WoT community, you’re the best!

Let us know what you thought of our content, correct us, send us things we may have missed to our email: roadtotarvalon@gmail.com You can find Amber on Twitter @Road to Tar Valon and Traci @MistressLaras, or Laras, Mistress of the Kitchens.  There’s a story there, but we’ll get to that another time.  We are on Instagram, roadtotarvalon.  We would love it if you would subscribe to us on Spotify, Anchor, Apple podcast or anywhere else you listen.  You can find more information on our webpage, anchor.fm/roadtotarvalon.  And if you have the anchor app, you can leave us a voice message that we can use in upcoming episodes.  Just let us know in the message if that’s something you are comfortable with or not.

So until next week,

Thanks for joining us!

Safe travels!

And walk in the light!

fields.title: E6 - The Forsaken pt. 2 | Petty, Envious, Horrifying, and Spoiler Free
fields.description:
Today we are wrapping up our history of the Forsaken.  We start with Traci’s favorite among the Chosen, Lanfear, and wrap up with the Spider herself, Moghedien.  We also respond to a message from WishBrother from the Weaves of the Wheel community and discuss a question that piqued our interest on Twitter posted by Forsaken Bob asking what people thought WoT’s chances of doing as well as GoT.

Thanks so much for joining us on this stretch of the Road to Tar Valon!  We love making this show every week, and always look forward to hearing from our listeners.  Thank you everyone for showing your support!  We launch shows every Wednesday and hope that you will continue to join us.  Next week we return with our New Spring recap, and we will be covering 4 chapters,  We also had a nice little chat around the passing of Robert Jordan and were lucky enough to get to use a snippet of a video clip from our new friend Lauren at Unraveling the Pattern.  He makes some amazing videos and you should definitely check him out and subscribe to his Youtube channel if you haven’t already. Thank you so much, Lauren!

Let us know what you thought of our content, correct us, send us things we may have missed to our email: roadtotarvalon@gmail.com You can find Amber on Twitter @Road to Tar Valon and Traci went through a Twitter rebirth!  You can now find her @MistressLaras, or Laras, Mistress of the Kitchens.  There’s a story there, but we’ll get to that another time.  We are on Instagram, roadtotarvalon.  We would love it if you would subscribe to us on Spotify, Anchor, Apple podcast or anywhere else you listen.  You can find more information on our webpage, anchor.fm/roadtotarvalon.  And if you have the anchor app, you can leave us a voice message that we can use in upcoming episodes.  Just let us know in the message if that’s something you are comfortable with or not.

So until next week,

Thanks for joining us!

Safe travels!

And walk in the light!

fields.title: E5 - The Forsaken pt. 1 | Petty, Envious, Horrifying, and Spoiler Free
fields.description:
What do you think of the Forsaken, the Chosen Ones, the Shadowsouled? This week we go SPOILER FREE on a dig through the history of the Forsaken.  Because, let’s be honest, they play a huge role in the books but their back story, for the most part, has to be pieced together throughout the series.  While this has its own level of fun, sometimes it’s just downright confusing.  Traci and Amber have an irreverent romp through the ins and outs of who is who and how they became the main adversaries to be wary of in the series. 

But, holy wow, we were not expecting to take over three hours to record this episode!  There was just too much to talk about.  So we made the episode a two parter and hope you’ll come back next week when we start off with Traci’s favorite among the Forsaken, Lanfear. 

Part of the conversation we had was in regards to an unofficial theme song for Ba’alzamon that’s hanging out on YouTube.  The channel is Department of Unrepresented Silence.  We did slip a snippet of the song into our Ishamael/Ba’alzamon discussion, but for the full version, you’ll need to follow the link. 

If you have questions or comments for us, you can email us at roadtotarvalon@gmail.com or reach us on Twitter; Amber is @RoadtoTarValon and Traci is @wannabeblue2.  We are also on instagram under Road to Tar Valon.

fields.title: E4 - Recap New Spring Chapters 5 & 6: Moiraine’s Ready to GTFO
fields.description:
New Spring is gaining momentum as Siuan and Moiraine take further steps to find the Dragon Reborn.  Traci and Amber recap these two chapters which end with Moiraine feeling hounded by several prominent Aes Sedai who hint at her taking the throne of Cairhien after the death of her uncles leaves a power vacuum with no set person to fill it.  Moiraine feels her hesitation at being tested for the shawl vanish as she realizes the best way to avoid the manipulations of Aes Sedai is to become one herself.
We were also sent a clip from our friend Robert, this time asking us how we felt about the direction of the show taking a more polyamourous approach as opposed to polygamous relationship among Rand, Elayne, Min, and Aviendha.  He also sent us the answer to the contraception question we posed last week. Thanks, Robert!
Next week we will be discussing the Forsaken! The goal is to have a spoiler free episode that focuses on the history of the Forsaken and how they found themselves swearing their souls to the Dark One.
If you have questions or comments for us, you can email us at roadtotarvalon@gmail.com or reach us on Twitter; Amber is @RoadtoTarValon and Traci is @wannabeblue2.  We are also on instagram under The Road to Tar Valon Podcast.

fields.title: E3 - Recap New Spring Chapters 3 & 4: Gobbling Goosemint & Black Ajah Everywhere!
fields.description:
So, we agreed, these two chapters were...uneventful but they laid a trail of breadcrumbs we couldn’t resist following.  Hosts Amber and Traci do a little Black Ajah uncovering, discuss the test for the Shawl for Aes Sedai, and try to figure out just what the heck does the White Tower DO with all its wealth and power.  SPOILERS abound in this episode past 20 minutes in, just so you are aware.
We would love to hear your thoughts on our content, as well as any questions, theories, or corrections you may have for us.  Email us at roadtotarvalon@gmail.com, find us on Instagram at roadtotarvalon and you can follow us on Twitter: Amber is @RoadtoTarValon and Traci is @wannabeblue2.  We love the Wheel of Time community and are thrilled to be a part of it in this way.

fields.title: E2 - Recap: New Spring Chapters 1 & 2
fields.description:
Ever wonder what happened before the adventure of the Wheel of Time took off in The Eye of the World?  How did Moiraine find her way to the Two Rivers?  What was she like as an accepted?  And what about Lan?  How was Moiraine able to bond a warrior like him as her warder? In this episode Amber and Traci dig into the first two chapters of New Spring, the prequel to the Wheel of Time series, and look to find answers to these questions and more.

The first half of the episode will be spoiler free, but the second half will be filled with observations and spoilers.  Included with these spoilers is a discussion around a particular ter’angreal mentioned last episode that a listener encouraged us to check out.  We did and it was not disappointing!  If you’re curious and have read through the path of daggers, check out the discussion on the Crimson Rod ter’angreal on Dragonmount.com.  We also discussed the new actresses announced to the Wheel of Time cast in the latter half of the episode, just to make sure we don’t unintentionally spoil anything for our listeners.  But, in case you’re wondering, we are in full support of the choices made for Min Farshaw (Kae Alexander), and Siuan Sanche (Sophie Okonedo) and can’t wait to see their portrayals of these characters.

We also want to apologize for the sound quality on this episode.  It’s not quite what we wanted it to be, but new equipment, new software, and the distance between us played against us this time.  We have since solved our sound issues and next episode will be in line with the quality we hope to move forward with.  We are new to this and learning as we go, so we really appreciate your patience and support as we take on these new technical challenges.

A quick correction as well!  When Amber is discussing the hammer and anvil tactic discussed in chapter one, she accidentally said the position she was talking about would be the hammer, but it is actually the anvil.  If you hear anything that we may have goofed on (especially pronunciations!) please get in touch with us and let us know!  We really want to make this a community oriented podcast and positive feedback is always welcomed and appreciated.

fields.title: E1: Prepping with some basics before you hit the dusty trail.
fields.description:
Hello friends!  We are thrilled you've chosen to join us on our journey down the Road to Tar Valon. This is a Wheel of Time podcast recapping the books, uncovering fan theories, discussing the upcoming TV show on Amazon prime, and unpacking the many intricacies of this incredible series. In this episode we focused on the magic system that runs central to the series along with the groups and individuals created around the magic system. We do this for fun and encourage you to join us in building an engaged community around this well loved series.   

In case you were wondering, Amber mentioned an app early in the episode that allows you to enter the book you are on that will give you information without including spoilers from future books. The app is called The Wheel of Time Compendium.  Definitely worth checking out. 

We will be back next week with a recap of chapters one and two of New Spring.  The first half of the episode will be spoiler free, the second half will not be.  Don't worry!  We will make sure to let you know when the spoilers start rolling.  We don't want to ruin the series for you! 

Until next time, stay safe and walk in the light.

fields.description:

The secrets are... well, they're secrets, so listen on to find out more! Specifically, the discussion centers around whether we truly want to know the answers to these mysteries, or whether, maybe, just maybe, keeping these secrets around preserves that certain je nais se quois that makes the Wheel of Time so special.

Author and noted Wheel of Time Fan C.L. Clark (Cherae) joins the Gleeman and the Innkeeper for a chat about their book, The Unbroken, a North African-inspired secondary world military fantasy with two incredibly strong women facing a world of danger, magic, and love. To top it all off, the book contains a veritable treasure trove of Wheel of Time easter eggs for the discerning reader. Join us as we talk to Cherae about their love of all things Wheel of Time, swords, and what it's like not being comfortable with yourself as a young person. And of course, pick up their book The Unbroken at the link below!

This week the crew is joined by the Innkeeper's son, Taylor, aka The Editor Reborn! An accomplished filmmaker himself, Taylor brings to the table his wealth of experience and insights into how he might re-shoot or restructure The Wheel of Time, Episode 1: Leavetaking. fields.title: Screentime with Camille
fields.description:
A very rational nerd (literally, their Twitter handle is @RationalNerd!) joins us this week to discuss the facts and data behind screen time in The Wheel of Time TV series from Amazon Prime. Who has the most screen time? Who has the least? What's the breakdown of those numbers? How long did it take to gather all of this data? Special guest Camille spills the beans and shares her deepest darkest secrets about how much time she actually spends... staring at screens.

Camille's blog post is here: https://rationalnerd62.tumblr.com/post/673512984165908481/the-wheel-of-time-screentime-season-1

Fellow nerd Petracore101 provided some data on speaking time, which you can find here: https://far-dareis-me.tumblr.com/post/671378621986914304/wheel-of-speaking-time-1x07

If you're a fan of this podcast, leave us a rating or review on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, or wherever you get your podcasts, or tell a friend about us!

fields.title: The Friends We Spoiled Along the Way
fields.description:
Matt the Innkeeper is BACK from vacation and ready to rock with your host, Brian the Gleeman, and long-time friend of the pod, Grace (aka @Bain_Chiad on Twitter). This week the gang discusses whether spoilers ruined their enjoyment of the TV series, why they chose to spoil themselves, and whether they would do it again for Season 2. What do you think? Spoilers, or non-spoilers?

Be sure to check out @Bain_Chiad's YouTube show, Three Fold Talk, every Thursday night at 9pm ET on @MalkierTalks' YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/c/MalkierTalks

If you enjoyed this podcast, leave a review on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, or wherever you get your podcast... or tell your friends about us!

fields.title: Egwene & Nynaeve Reactions
fields.description: Join Brian and special guest co-host Mary (aka Frenzy) in this week's episode while Matt the Innkeeper is out on vacation! Brian and Mary are joined by an old Theoryland friend, Cary, who brought a fun topic: What did we think of Egwene and Nynaeve in the show? Listen along as the gang discusses Egwene and Nynaeve and all of the nuances of their characters. And let us know what you think! Ping us on Twitter at @BarsideChatsPod or email us at barsidechatspodcast@gmail.com!

fields.title: Recaps & Resolutions
fields.description: In the 2022 season debut episode of Barside Chats, Brian and Matt discuss their thoughts on the entirety of Season 1, as well as specifically focusing on Episode 8, the season finale of the show. Plus, they share their New Years' resolutions!

fields.title: A Non-Reader Reacts (No Book Spoilers!)
fields.description: Join Brian and Matt as they meet with Sharnise, and her boyfriend Dunkin. Dun is a non-reader who has been consuming the show voraciously. He shares his insights, questions, and theories with us in this hour-long adventure!

fields.title: Episode Six Reactions (and an Eye of the World Rant!)
fields.description: Join Brian the Gleeman and Matt the Innkeeper as they share their reactions and thoughts about Episode Six, a little bit about Episode Five, and a rather epic rant about the Eye of the World and... why is anyone complaining about this stuff?! Plus, a potential Wheel of Time parody song opportunity...

fields.title: Angsty Review Roundup
fields.description: Join Brian the Gleeman & Matt the Innkeeper as we do a roundup of some angsty reviews and comments that we found on The Dusty Wheel website. Do these reviews have a point? Are they justified? Or are they just angry people with no sense whatsoever? What we discovered might surprise you! Let us know what you think!

fields.title: Wheel of Time Season One (and our thoughts so far!)
fields.description: Brian chats about the first half of Season One of The Wheel of Time series with co-host Matt the Innkeeper and special guest Mary, aka Frenzy aka Dark Mother. They discuss each of the episodes and share their thoughts about them, and each person brings some insights that the others hadn't considered.

fields.title: The Wheel of Time Series UNLEASHED
fields.description: Brian & Matt are joined by special guests, Grace and Sharnise, for this week's episode as they discuss the FIRST THREE EPISODES OF THE WHEEL OF TIME SERIES OH MY GOD IT'S OUT IT'S OUT IT'S OUT. Um, yes. That. They discuss that. And maybe they play some games! Tune in to find out.

fields.title: Trailer'gaidon Debrief with the Innkeeper
fields.description:
A little under two weeks ago we had a special Trailer'gaidon! The Dusty Wheel partnered with Amazon Prime to bring us a TEN HOUR livestream, full of goodies like a pre-recorded note from showrunner Rafe Judkins, interviews with Daniel, Zoe, Madeline, and, of course, Rosamund, as well as the world premiere of one of Lorne Balfe's songs during his own interview with the Innkeeper. It was a heck of a ride. Brian finally got a few minutes to catch up with Matt and get the skinny on that day. Also, some news about the future of The Dusty Wheel and Barside Chats! Tune in to find out more!

If you enjoyed this podcast, leave a review on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, or wherever you get your podcast... or tell your friends about us!

fields.title: Teaser'gaidon: Behind the Scenes
fields.description:
Teaser'gaidon is here! The Amazon Prime Wheel of Time TV series finally dropped the first major teaser on Thursday, September 2, 2021, and our very own Innkeeper held an incredible 12-hour marathon livestream on The Dusty Wheel. The Gleeman was able to catch up with Matt and do a little debriefing on how the livestream went, what his favorite parts were, and what are some of his hopes and dreams for the future. Listen in for a little behind-the-scenes peek at the Innkeeper's thoughts!

If you haven't seen the Wheel of Time trailer, check it out HERE: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3Fus4Xb_TLg

If you enjoyed this podcast, leave a review on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, or wherever you get your podcast... or tell your friends about us!

Matt and Brian are joined by returning guests Todd and Tyler, and they tackle the big questions: why THESE photos? why not certain other photos? is Lord of the Rings really just the fantasy version of the Avengers?


Tell us what YOU think!

Joining us are Todd and Mary, of Theoryland fame and frequent contributors to The Dusty Wheel's Live TV Adaptation segments. Join us as we talk about why we would or would not want to be a Hero, and if we were a Hero, what would our hero powers be?


What do you think? Would YOU be a Hero?!

fields.title: Author Interview: Michael Livingston
fields.description:
Our special guest this week is Professor Michael Livingston. He is a Professor of English at The Citadel in South Carolina, and author of the fantasy series The Shards of Heaven and the Audible Original, Seaborn. He is also a historian that studies medieval conflicts, and his claim to fame is moving battlefields. Who does that?! Listen as we interview this madman and genius extraordinaire.

Buy his most recent publication, 1066: The Guide to the Battles and Campaigns here.

Any questions for Michael? Let us know! Tweet us at @BarsideChatsPod on Twitter or email us at barsidechatspodcast@gmail.com.

Check it out!

Specifically, the fact that time is circular and repeats itself. We'll dive into the metaphysics as well as discussing how it affects the writing of the books themselves. Be sure to check out Drew's podcast if you enjoy this one!

The Innkeeper is out today, but the Gleeman meets up with Andrew from The Black Tower Podcast to discuss an insurrection at the United States Capitol building and what parallels we might find at the White Tower in The Wheel of Time.

Hear more from our guest Andrew at The Black Tower Pod (https://blacktowerpod.podbean.com/). He is part of an EXCELLENT podcast, and we highly recommend you subscribe!

fields.title: Essential Perrin
fields.description:
With the TV series upon us, we decided to take a stab at streamlining the series, starting with The Gleeman's favorite character, Lord Goldeneyes himself, Perrin Aybara. Given that the story is ultimately about the Dragon Reborn and his fight against the Dark One, what parts of Perrin's story are extraneous? What can we cut, merge together, or twist around to fit as much of the "essential Perrin" into the show as we can, without going off on tangents that take books to resolve?! Matt and Brian are joined by their good friend Lisa, aka Saucy Blue Confetti, to discuss refining the Essential Perrin. This is the first of our Essentials series!

Remember to subscribe and leave us a review if you would like to support this podcast, so that others can find us.

Next section, airing next week: Chapter 37, up through the line which includes "Through a gateway, off the battlefield." In Preeti's edition (https://bookshop.org/p/books/a-memory-of-light-book-fourteen-of-the-wheel-of-time-robert-jordan/15554228?ean=9780765337856&next=t), it's at the top of page 709, about halfway through this mega-chapter.

fields.title: Bonus: Jenn Reviews Thinks She Thought She Remembered
fields.description:
Approximately a thousand years ago, when we were early in the days of this project, I made a doc of things I thought I remembered. It's been updated sporadically, but at 2am the other morning I found myself thinking about it, and decided to do a thing. And here is that thing! Background noises by new co-host Fizz. Patrons will get to see a behind-the-scenes photo of us recording, via Patreon.


NOTE: Here be spoilers! If you're current with the TVOB book episodes, you're good until minute 12:50. After that, proceed at your own risk.


I finish up with some things I think I remember that we either haven't gotten to yet, or that I fully made up. I'll have to do another revisit when we're fully done with the series, I guess!

Get bonus content on Patreon

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

fields.title: Kink Therapy in the Borderlands
fields.description:
In this week's Very Special Bonus Episode, Jenn and Preeti are joined by half of the romance author duo, Kit Rocha -- Bree! Bree very kindly walks us through the romance and sexy times of the Wheel of Time. It gets kind of weird, but in a good way? Not in a getting spanked in the Ways kind of way, we swear. CN: Please be prepared for frank conversations about kink, sex, and consent!


KIT ROCHA is the pseudonym for co-writing team Donna Herren and Bree Bridges. After penning dozens of paranormal novels, novellas and stories as Moira Rogers, they branched out into gritty, sexy dystopian romance.


The Beyond series has appeared on the New York Times and USA Today bestseller lists, has been nominated for best erotic romance in the RT Reviewer’s Choice award five times, and won in 2013 and 2015. Their most recent adventure is partnering with Tor to launch their critically acclaimed Mercenary Librarians series.


Follow Bree on twitter right here: https://twitter.com/mostlybree


The Wheel Takes Podcast


Lezbi Nerdy on YouTube

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

fields.title: The Great Hunt, Prologue - Chapter 10
fields.description:
This week Preeti and Jenn dig into the Prologue through Chapter 10 of The Great Hunt -- like, REALLY dig in -- and talk about how much they hate Liandrin, new POV rules, some annoying narrative choices, and more.


Also, Jenn does know about the White Walkers in Game of Thrones, whoops, but feels like her point still stands, JUST SAYING.


QUIZ: Wheel of Time Sword Form or Kama Sutra Sex Act?


For next time, we'll be reading Chapters 11-18, because wow so much to talk about!

fields.title: Episode 17: Life is Life-ing (TEoTW Ch 33 - 34)
fields.description:
Jambo, Listener Friends, Friend Listeners! We have missed you all! Thank you for being patient as we navigate our personal lives. This episode was actually recorded on July 4, 2023 so please ignore all references to the date lol. While we are (briefly) back, please join us as we discuss chapters 33 and 34 of The Eye of The World. Keba has a few predictions about what happens after the infamous road trip to Caemlyn. Keba and Shar also share their 9/11 stories and surprisingly Keba has no shade for Matrim Cauthon.

As always, please join us on ⁠⁠Discord⁠⁠ and tell us what you think about this episode (and join the spoiler channel and chat with us about Keba's Asinine Predictions).

Thank you to all of our Patreon Subscribers. Y'all are the real MVP's: skeeterish, Ian, Shelly, Teetee78, Charlie Edmunds, Ashokova, Anya Lienau, April, George Justin Merrell, Jason Denzel, Iman, Spencer R., Stephen Rees-Carter, Screamin Spudmonkey, Dee Tee, LightBlindedFool, Leah, Malkier Talks, Bain&Chiad, Jasus Lord, Talib Hudson, Rob Christianson, Ms_Kei, Melissa J, Goatbrother, Mistress Dovie, MorShadi, lumen, Koala Sedai, and Aradiapedia.

fields.description:

We are FINALLY back with a new episode! We truly apologize for the delay (again) as life just keeps on life-ing for us. We are forever grateful for your support and grace. Please enjoy!


Also, HAPPY PRIDE!!!!!!!


In this episode, we get into chapters 27 and 28 of The Eye of the World. We also discuss listening to your gut, the Wonders of the World, and we revisit ALL of Keba's Asinine Predictions. fields.description:
We are back (finally; apologies for the delay, life was "lifing") with Episode 12 where Keba and Shar dive into chapters 23 and 24 of Book 1 of The Wheel of Time, The Eye of The World.

In this episode, Keba has a new toy so please turn your volume down. We now have limited sound effects and Keba loves pressing those buttons. We also have our first Black Ajah discussion, Keba is apparently Shar's mental health therapist, and we both agree that the mind is extremely powerful.

As always, please join us on Discord and tell us what you think about this episode (and join the spoiler channel and chat with us about Keba's Asinine Predictions).

fields.title: Episode 10: Live from JordanCon 2023! (TEoTW Ch 19 - 20)
fields.description:
Episode 10 is here! We are live from JordanCon 2023! Special shout out to Kelly, Ms. Kei, Melissa, and Justin who joined us live on the couch. We truly enjoyed having you with us.

Listen in as we discuss chapters 19 and 20 of The Eye of The World. Find out why what happens in Shadar Logoth, stays in Shadar Logoth. Resident guest CallMeNakomi slays us with her recaps of the chapters (did y'all know that Mordeth was Beelzebub's play cousin?). We also have a brief discourse on destiny vs. decisions. Do we really have free will in the Pattern? Let us know what you think by joining the discussion on Discord. Thank you to all of our Patreon Subscribers. Y'all are the real MVP's: Teetee78, Charlie Edmunds, Ashokova, Anya Lienau, April, George Justin Merrell, Jason Denzel, Iman, Spencer R., Stephen Rees-Carter, Screamin Spudmonkey, Dee Tee, LightBlindedFool, Leah, Malkier Talks, Bain&Chiad, Jasus Lord, Talib Hudson, Rob Christianson, Ms_Kei, Melissa J, Goatbrother, Mistress Dovie, MorShadi, lumen, Koala Sedai, Aradiapedia, and Gorgo Big Ups: Ali and Gus of Wheel Takes: https://www.spreaker.com/show/wheel-takes Connect with CallMeNakomi: www.youtube.com/@callmenakomi3655 Art by: @nyaxonoi and @wotincolor Edited by: @wotincolor and Rhuarc Connect with us: linktr.ee/wotincolor Support us on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/wotincolor Join the conversation on Discord: ⁠https://discord.gg/HH2pTzSWrn⁠ WoT In Color is recorded exclusively at TMH Studios

fields.description:
Our Heart is broken while Alyssa and Koala are at WoTCon 2024 and Rob and Lauren are holding down the forts at home. In this episode we get a surprise call from Alyssa and Koala with WoTCon updates, Rob puts a big ol' Seanchan deathhorn in his mouth, and we are joined by our good friend and follower Patrick Lightbody!

Topics discussed include WoTCon, WOT Idol, Rob's future podcast plans, Lauren's YouTube channel "Unraveling the Pattern", Amazon Prime's "The Wheel of Time" seasons 2-3, Lauren's trip to the Two Rivers in Prague, and we are joined by Sifl the Taint Puppet!

Give us a listen or you MIGHT be a Darkfriend!

fields.title: You're Not the Boss of Me - Mental barriers to content creation
fields.description: The Darkfriends discuss inner voices and obstacles to content creation, especially leading up to WOT Idol, and Alyssa, Koala and Rob are joined once again by the amazing WOT Cake Lady, Penny! Lauren pops in now and then while making a waygate-load of cinnamon rolls, and Koala tells us all about her new Wheel of Time themed card game, Questioners Vs. Darkfriends! Don't miss this one!

fields.title: JordanCon not ConstantiFOMO
fields.description:
The Darkfriends discuss the mutual FOMO of missing JordanCon 2024, tips for overcoming social anxiety and what they love the most about the Wheel of Time fandom. Why did They Might Be Darkfriends get the works? That's nobody's business but the Nerds!

fields.title: Spiraling Shape: The lure of content creation
fields.description:

fields.title: Sleep: Dealing with Imposter Syndrome
fields.description:
The Darkfriends are joined by special guest Rhuarc, host of the Watch Party: Wheel of Time podcast, as they don't discuss sleep, bur rather Imposter Sydrome IRL within the fandom and as dealt with by characters in the Wheel of Time books and show.


--

SHOW NOTES: Hello and welcome to They Might Be Darkfriends, a podcast for friends and fans of the Wheel of Time where we discuss anything and everything showing the ups, downs, and tips related to content creation. And lately we've been discussing mental health in the fandom. We're also big fans of They Might Be Giants, a weird band from the 90s that's still making music today. This week - guest Rhuarc joins our four hosts to discuss a topic near and dear to our hearts: Imposter Syndrome - in our lives and in the story we love most Wheel of Time. Rhuarc hosts another Podcast: WatchParty Wheel of Time. Have you listened to them yet? With co-host Saimma and 6 panel members who have not read the books, they get into some fascinating discussions as they work through the TV Show episodes and lots of deep dives.

Catch them here: https://wotwatchparty.com/ DISCLAIMER: By no means are we experts. So if you're listening to this podcast and things resonate with you, that's great. We're happy about that. But we also don't want you to necessarily take everything we say as gospel. If there's a need for mental health awareness, if you need to take care of mental illness, please reach out to actual professionals and experts. We are just kind of our own little personal support group, but we don't, you know, we're not experts.

TL;DR version:

Watch Party Wheel of Time: https://wotwatchparty.wordpress.com/


They Might Be Darkfriends' Patreon:

https://www.patreon.com/TheyMightBeDarkfriends




This episode was inspired by They Might Be Giant's "Sleep" - https://youtu.be/FSbEOZY7k20?si=DUgbZFgYk8sRikqt

Lyrics: Each (ahh) Time (ahh) I (ahh) Sleep (ahh) I'm (ahh) Sad (ahh) I (ahh) Will be replaced by somebody else In the morning Exactly like me Going around, drinking all my drinks Kissing my wife Thinking what I think Making me resentful but Each Time I Get up in the morning I'm glad I Took Someone else's place

fields.title: Unrelated Thing: Procrastination Guilt and Seasonal Affective Disorder
fields.description: This week, the Darkfriends welcome a new cast-member, Koala Sedai, and have a freeform discussion about seasonal affective disorder, procrastination guilt, imposter syndrome and a lot of other things we deal with as content creators.

fields.title: How Much Cake Can You Eat: Social Anxiety & Masking
fields.description: Alyssa and Rob are joined by Penny the WOT Cake Lady and the lovely Koala Sedai as they discuss social anxiety WITHIN the fandom, as well as debate whether or not carrot cake counts as cake.

fields.title: Till My Head Falls Off: Mental Tolls of Content Creation
fields.description: Start counting up your Advil, Darkfriends! Lauren tells all about his trip to Prague and Jordan Studios, the Darkfriends discuss the mental toll of being a content creator, and Rob makes a startling confession. But don't worry, we're not done and we won't be 'till our heads fall off!

fields.title: Particle Man: The Wheel of Time show news
fields.description: In They Might Be Darkfriends’ 5th episode, PARTICLE MAN, the Darkfriends hang out with MorShadi and talk show news, Season 2 and 3 expectations, TTRPGs, accessibility on Twitter and more! Is MorShadi rad, or is he bad? When he’s on a podcast does he get mad? Nobody knows Particle Man… but now you will! --

fields.title: Why Must I Be Sad? - Highs & Lows of Content Creation
fields.description: In They Might Be Darkfriends’ 4th episode, the gang has a group therapy session on the ups and downs of Content Creation, and welcomes their first special guest, Koala Sedai, for a warm discussion on the good, the bad and the Olver of recent Wheel of Time news and experiences, including JordanCon and WOT Idol. Koala also shares some of her work on her on her amazing conservation property (https://linktr.ee/koalagardens). You’ll laugh, you’ll cry, you’ll kiss two hours goodbye!

fields.title: How Can I Sing Like A Girl?: WoT Idol 2023
fields.description:
Rob and Lauren discuss some recent Wheel of Time news and then discuss some Frequently Asked Questions regarding the upcoming Wheel of Time Song Parody Contest or WoT Idol 2023! We compare WoT Idol to the They Might Be Giants song entitled "How Can I Sing Like A Girl?"

Episode spoilers include some Wheel of Time romance spoilers through book 7, A Crown of Swords.

  • Jump to 18:30 for the spoiler free WoT Idol discussion!
  • Lauren apologizes for his "creaking chair" sounds throughout the episode.
  • Learn more at WoTIdol.com

fields.title: It's Not My Birthday: Our 2nd Episode
fields.description: The three nerds ramble about Wheel of Time (would you erase your WoT knowledge and start over?) and They Might Be Giants with some slight attempts at structure! That structure includes the segments "You might be a Darkfriend if....?", "What made YOU fall in Love with the Wheel of Time," (Alyssa responds this week), and "Nerd Corner," in which Rob explains his long time interest in tabloids. As always, we end with a sneak peek into upcoming Weekly Wheel News headlines.

fields.title: Don't Let's Start: Unraveling the Pattern Livestream
fields.description:
Welcome to They Might Be Darkfriends - Revealing the Mysteries and Stories Behind the Wheel of Time Fandom!

Hosted by Lauren (Unraveling the Pattern), Rob (Weekly Wheel News) and Alyssa (One Power Ballads)

This premiere episode was recorded as a livestream in conjunction with the 3rd Year Anniversary of Lauren's very first video release on his YouTube Channel.

We discuss how to uncover darkfriends, introduce the theme of the podcast (and theme song!), celebrate 3 fabulous years of Unraveling the Pattern, ponder the unlikelihood of being narcissist with imposter syndrome, nerd out in the "Nerd Corner" with Lauren, get a hint of the next WWN headline, and more!

fields.title: KPod Episode 22 - LegoTalks III,  better late than never (ft. Sulin)
fields.description:
Welcome back to The Kevin Podcast! (and friends).

This special bonus episode was recorded and livestreamed on Rob's YouTube channel on August 11th 2023. The format for LegoTalks of Time episodes will be myself and Rob (of MalkierTalks) will interview a guest. While we chat, we will all be building something from a single prompt with Legos. The resulting conversation is what follows. This will be livestreamed on Rob's Youtube channel linked below, and then uploaded to this feed afterwards.

In this LegoTalks of Time episode, Rob and I talk with our good friend Becci, also known online as Sulin, She is well known in The Wheel of Time community for her kind and thoughtful personality, as well as co-hosting The Flickerverse! Enjoy the conversation we had with her that shouldve gone up here around 8 months ago, but for some reason just didn't! Bubble of Evil? shrug

You can find Sulin on twitter here: https://twitter.com/SulinGoshien

Subscribe to The Flickerverse here: https://www.youtube.com/@TheFlickerverse

Find Rob's channel here: https://www.youtube.com/@MalkierTalks

Find Rob's Twitter here: https://twitter.com/MalkierTalks

Find my Youtube channel here: https://youtube.com/@TheKevinPodcast

Find my Twitter here: https://twitter.com/GradeKangusBeef

Find my basically everything else here: https://linktr.ee/thekevinpodcast

Watch the livestream version of this episode here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-kmami0A23U

Music powered by Epidemic Sound.

Stand by for Season 4 of The Kevin Podcast (and friends), coming soon.

fields.description:

This special bonus episode was recorded Live at JordanCon 2023 in Atlanta, Georgia.

The format for LegoTalks of Time episodes will be myself and Rob (of MalkierTalks) will interview a guest. While we chat, we will all be building something from a single prompt with Legos. Join us this time, as we discuss whether mermaids are myth or reality (myth), Kevin rhythmically discloses how he visualizes a "cool dad", and we have the official scoop on Connor's efforts in the country Togo. This part includes establishing an internet cafe AND a factory powered by the contents of flushable toilets... Can't make this stuff up.

If you somehow listen to all of this, please tell me. I will admire you and list you in the KPod Hall of Fame. Anyways, April Fools, and I'll see you all for Season 2 on 5/1/2022!

If you like the show, maybe share it with a friend, or think about sending us questions for guests/Kevin in an email at kevin.podcast.and.friends@gmail.com, or in a message on instagram @thekevinpodcast . Thanks, you are the best.

After a much needed hiatus, and on the KPOD's 1st anniversary, this episode features another return of the legendary Tom Horton, your host Kevin Angus, and our first ever celebrity guest, Count Dracula! Join us this time, as we discuss the differences between Jimmy Johns vs Papa Johns, I share a short scary story I wrote, and Count Dracula spills the tea on a huge scandal he uncovered.

The Kevin Podcast! (and friends) will officially be returning with Season 2 this spring!

If you like the show, maybe share it with a friend, or think about sending us questions for guests/Kevin in an email at kevin.podcast.and.friends@gmail.com, or in a message on instagram @thekevinpodcast . Thanks, you really nailed it.

If you like the show, maybe share it with a friend, or think about sending us questions for guests/Kevin in an email at kevin.podcast.and.friends@gmail.com, or in a message on instagram @thekevinpodcast . Thanks, you really nailed it.

Ben probably prefers you don't find him, but he will return to the show soon, so submit your questions for him by email or instagram!

If you like the show, maybe share it with a friend, or think about sending us questions for guests/Kevin in an email at kevin.podcast.and.friends@gmail.com, or in a message on instagram @thekevinpodcast . Thanks. You're too kind.

If you like the show, maybe share with a friend, or think about sending us Q's for guests/Kevin in an email at kevin.podcast.and.friends@gmail.com, or in a message on instagram @thekevinpodcast

If you want to submit questions for future guests, you can contact us at kevin.podcast.and.friends@gmail.com, or in a message on instagram @thekevinpodcast.

Jon Benjamin.

If you want to submit questions for future guests (specific or otherwise), you can contact us at kevin.podcast.and.friends@gmail.com, or in a message on instagram @thekevinpodcast. OK, thanks, enjoy. No need to keep reading, no additional jokes or information will be provided at the end of this. There will be no payoff. Toodles.

Check out some of Nick's active creative endeavors, like 'Yeah Universe', 'Victory Soul Orchestra', 'Baseball & Such', and 'PokeLore'... Wow!

I also have really poor sleeping habits (not really working on it). Cool beans.

Music courtesy of Epidemic Sound.

fields.title: ReWoTching Season 1 - Episode 8: I Wanted a Cheeseburger, and Instead I Got Chocolate Cake
fields.description:
A year after the premiere, we are back to talking all about the Wheel of Time on Amazon Prime! We've watched the season, we've had 12 months to reflect, and we are coming to you once more to talk about Season One with new insights, questions, and hot takes.

This week, Greyhame Confusion and Delusions of Graendal are joined by the unparalleled host of Wheel Takes, Ali and Gus to discuss Episode 8 - The Eye of the World. We dive into the benefits of eating chocolate cake instead dirt, where Perrin's star truly shines, and whether all hope is lost as we look forward to Season Two on the horizon. 

Subscribe, and leave a review if you're so inclined! We'll be coming to you fresh every Thursday.

fields.title: S.2 Episode 1: Come on Baby, Rings my Power
fields.description:
After a 9 month hiatus, Feather and Mountain is back, baby! We've got a new co-host in the hot seat as we delve into the Lord of the Rings: the Rings of Power on Amazon Prime. Our fearless Wheel of Time veteran, Delusions of Graendal, puts on the #NeverReader cap for this series, as her Tolkien enthusiast father - better known as our new co-host, Greyhame Confusion - helps guide new and old fans alike through this epic fantasy. 

This week, we dive into Episodes 1 and 2 of the Rings of Power. Is it possible for a Tolkiener to actually find quality content in the new show? Or do we have a secret review bomber in our midst? Tune in to find out!

fields.title: 2/9: The Great Kickoff
fields.description:
The Hunt doesn't launch until chapter ten, so Morgan explores up through chapter 9 and examines RJ's use of juxtaposition in his world-building. If she had known pre-recording that there's a literary device called "juxtaposition" that succinctly describes what she's talking about, she would have used it a whole bunch. Sounding smarter would help make up for the fact that she says Padan Fain's initials are F.P.

"He will be born to the ones chill with nudity, but raised by ones super uptight. 

And there will come a time when he needs power that's easy to consume and won't hurt his tummy. 

And you must place it in a vessel, and call it an Eye, because he won't recognize a breast." 

Watch Morgan be awkward! Click the link to see her livestream on the Twotcast Charity Podcastathon! She shows up at about 39:50. https://youtu.be/opRgrHkuBFs. fields.title: 1/2: There Are No Therapists in Randland
