fields.title: S1 Ep10: The Dragon Reborn (104) Commentary
fields.description:
This is just fun, I hope you all are enjoying bringing us along to your own rewatch. We notice a few new and interesting things and then I spend the last 5 minutes just oohing and awing as the Aes Sedai kick some false dragon ass.

Please send questions and comments to thankthelight@gmail.com 

Please Like, Subscribe, and tell a friend about Thank the Light.

Find more great podcasts here at What Sounds Awesome from We Mixed It

fields.title: S1 Ep9: A Place of Safety (103) Commentary
fields.description:
We filled the air with some words, but we kind of just enjoyed watching this episode together, we had a couple moments we failed to notice on the first viewing. This is a little bit of a breather episode after the splitting up of our heroes at the end of episode 2. We were lucky enough to have one extra WoT friend join us on the watch party; she joins the virtual discussion to keep us on our toes. Thank you Barbara Sedia!

If you are planning a rewatch, I hope you bring us with you so we can all "watch" together. We touch on a few other subjects as well to make it a fun listen whether you're in front of your screen or not. 

Please send questions and comments to thankthelight@gmail.com 

Please Like, Subscribe, and tell a friend about Thank the Light.

Find more great podcasts here at What Sounds Awesome from We Mixed It

fields.title: S1 Ep8: Shadow’s Waiting (102) Commentary
fields.description:
Don’t let the intro fool ya, it’s a NEW episode!!

This was so much fun! Just hanging out with my Wolfbrother Justin aka @ParchedAielman rewatching Episode 102 Shadow’s Waiting and BSing all the while. If you are planning a rewatch, I hope you bring us with you so we can all "watch" together. We touch on a few other subjects as well to make it a fun listen whether you're in front of your screen or not. 

Please send questions and comments to thankthelight@gmail.com 

Please Like, Subscribe, and tell a friend about Thank the Light.

Find more great podcasts here at What Sounds Awesome from We Mixed It

fields.title: S1 Ep7: Leavetaking (101) Commentary
fields.description:
This was so much fun! Just hanging out with my Wolfbrother Justin aka @ParchedAielman rewatching Episode 101 Leavetaking and BSing all the while. If you are planning a rewatch, I hope you bring us with you so we can all "watch" together. We touch on a few other subjects as well to make it a fun listen whether your in front of your screen or not. Happy New Year!!!

Please send questions and comments to thankthelight@gmail.com 

Please Like, Subscribe, and tell a friend about Thank the Light.

Find more great podcasts here at What Sounds Awesome from We Mixed It

fields.title: S1 Ep6: Season One Summary
fields.description:
Justin and Desmond talk about season one of The Wheel of Time. We go all over the place getting more and more excited with each reminder of great moments from the visual introduction to the great book series. No more spoilery than our past summaries, a few bread crumbs of what's to come, but now that we know who The Dragon is, everything else is just good conversation. 

Please let us know some directions you would like us to take our deep dives, what you love, or don’t, about season one and what you hope is to come next season. Send questions and comments to thankthelight@gmail.com 

Please Like, Subscribe, and tell a friend about Thank the Light.

Find more great podcasts here at What Sounds Awesome from We Mixed It

fields.title: S1 Ep5: Season 1 Episode 8: The Eye Of The World
fields.description:
Season One Finale, Folks!

“For twenty years, Moiraine has dreamed and worked towards this moment. But she can't stop the Dragon Reborn from seeing the appeal of the Dark.”

We are in it now, Lighters. Justin and Desmond get into this episode and everything it means for the upcoming seasons and leaves us tons to discuss during the upcoming offseason. Dragons are reborn, gaps are plugged, taints are empowered, a whole new race is revealed, holy crap! 

Please let us know some directions you would like us to take our deep dives, what you love, or don’t, about season one and what you hope is to come next season. Send questions and comments to thankthelight@gmail.com 

Please Like, Subscribe, and tell a friend about Thank the Light.

Find more great podcasts here at What Sounds Awesome from We Mixed It

fields.title: S1 Ep4: Season 1 Episode 7: The Dark Along the Ways
fields.description: Moiraine and her charges are diverted from their path by an unexpected encounter. This diversion, though, reveals many things — Moiraine’s true goal, Lan’s past, the fractures that have grown in the group, and the identity of the Dragon Reborn.

fields.title: S1 Ep3: Season 1 Episode 6: The Flame of Tar Valon
fields.description: Season 1, Episode 6 - We meet a young Siuan Sanche, AKA the Amyrlin Seat. Moiraine and Siuan are secretly working together to find the Dragon Reborn and are also “pillow friends”. Moiraine gathers the Two Rivers villagers at a Waygate where they will travel to the Eye of the World to confront the Dark One and uncover who the Dragon Reborn is. Mat hesitates...

fields.title: S1 Ep2: Season 1 Episode 5: Blood Calls Blood
fields.description:
Season 1, Episode 5: Blood Calls Blood. In our second episode Justin starts off with some missed bullet points from our last show. Then we spend a nice long time in the white tower breaking down the episode and some Ta'veren politics. 

Please listen, like, subscribe and join the conversation; send question, comments, and requests to thankthelight@gmail.com

fields.title: S1 Ep1: Season 1 Episode 1, 2, 3, 4: Leavetaking, and a lot more
fields.description: In our inaugural show, Justin and Desmond break down the first 4 episodes of the new series, The Wheel of Time, based on the Robert Jordan novels. We had a lot to cover, and did a pretty good job, if I do say so myself. Justin is a long time fan of the books and I am just coming into the series now, so we make a great team for the die hard fan and the uninitiated. Please listen and join in the conversation so we can all get to know this World a little bit better. In the future we will get them out one episode at a time soon after Amazon releases them for some hot after show analysis.

fields.title: Episode 79: Is Sammael Toast?
fields.description:
Anas and Grace break down the fandom's reactions to Season 3 Episode 6 of The Wheel of Time, including that bawdy body song no one can get out of their head.

*Episode contains book series spoilers through Towers of Midnight*

fields.title: Episode 68: Live from JordanCon
fields.description:
Anas and Grace record live from JordanCon 2024, outside in the courtyard at the same location where #PicnicTableCon took place two years prior. They chat roundtable style with a bunch of great guests, including Wheel of Time Continuity Editor, Maria Simons, and Origins of the Wheel of Time author, Dr. Michael Livingston. One of the biggest topics of discussion was JordanCon Guest of Honor and Wheel of Time cast member, Guy Roberts (Uno), who made quite an impression on Con-goers—but maybe not for the reason you think!

fields.title: Episode 61: End Rant
fields.description:
Inspired by Grace's outrage after finishing Mistborn Era 1, we discuss what makes a good ending and whether the Wheel of Time fandom would exist if the series did not have a satisfying conclusion.


This episode is all about endings, so major spoilers abound! Please read carefully below before listening (unless you're into being spoiled).


FULL SPOILERS for The Wheel of Time (books and TV series, including S3 speculation), Mistborn Era 1, Oathbringer, A Few Good Men, Oppenheimer, LOST, Lord of the Rings (movies), Smallville, Saw, Fight Club, and Big Fish.


SOFT SPOILERS for The Dark Knight, Dark, Castle Rock, 11.22.63, The Dark Tower, First Law, Game of Thrones, Rings of Power, Twin Peaks, The Great Gatsby (books and movie), Warrior, Contagion, and The Last of Us.


Related Links


Check out our website!

fields.description:

We invited the Dragonmother of the fandom, Tigraine/Shaiel from #TwitterOfTime, to discuss her journey as one of the OG Wheel of Time role-play accounts. Lots of laughs and nostalgia ensue as we dig up some of her most notable tweets from the early days of ToT up through the more uncertain times now.

fields.description:

fields.description:

In unrelated news, we really enjoy the tracks "Nynaeve al'Meara," "Darkness and Shadows," and "Last Light" from the Season 2 Soundtrack.

fields.title: Episode 53: The Innkeeper's Wife
fields.description:
Anas and Grace sit down with Teri Hatch, aka The Innkeeper's Wife at The Dusty Wheel, to hear about her experience of the fandom over the years, in particular since her home became an Inn four years ago. Along the way, we talk about genres (other than fantasy?), how Cons are like concerts, and why it's the small things that are often the brightest examples of The Light's Work.

**This episode contains full spoilers for Season 2 of The Wheel of Time TV Series**

fields.description:
Anas and Grace discuss all things spoiler, including how the fandom has approached spoilers over the years, the varying windows of tolerance for spoilers, their own experiences of being spoiled, and the existence of Spoilers that are Not Spoilers, aka Faux Spoilers.

fields.title: Episode 16: Obsessed - Is WoT Fandom a Cult?
fields.description:
Where do you draw the line between fandom and fanaticism? Are fan gatherings any different from the ecstatic rituals of religious zealots? And how do you explain yourself to loved ones who think you've gone overboard? Anas and Grace explore the answers to these questions and reflect on whether WoT fandom has anything in common with the dark and dangerous world of cults.
CW: This episode contains discussion of cults, including a list of the qualities of a cult and description of cult activities, including and mass suicide. Also a brief discussion of violent riots during sports games and concerts.

fields.title: Episode 8: Surprisology - Why We Love Secrets & Surprises
fields.description:
One of the core tenets of The Light's Work is surprising people with seemingly random acts of kindness. This is something Anas and Grace absolutely love doing and in this episode they discuss why this is so important to them. *THIS EPISODE CONTAINS FULL BOOKS SPOILERS - TIMESTAMPS (43:50-45:35) (1:050:00-1:06:25)*

fields.title: Episode 7: Faith in Rafe - Fandom and Show Interaction
fields.description:
*This episode contains a SPOILER from The Gathering Storm (27:15-27:20)*
In this week’s episode, Anas and Grace examine the unique relationship between the Wheel of Time fandom and the Amazon Prime TV show production, in particular Showrunner Rafe Judkins. As they review tweets leading up to Season 1 from Rafe and the official Wheel of Time account aka “Tweeter of Chaos,” they discuss how the show’s direct contact with fans is all about trust and then speculate as to how fans may influence the production itself.

Anas and Grace sat down with Sara from WoT Series on their recent trip to Charleston, SC for OgierCon 2022. As an integral part of the WoT Series crew (with three other awesome people), Sara provided an inside look at the amazing work WoT Series does in investigating and breaking show news and how that brings so much joy and happiness to the Fandom.

fields.title: Episode 5: The Innkeeper - The Importance of The Dusty Wheel
fields.description:
Anas and Grace sit down with Matt Hatch, The Innkeeper at The Dusty Wheel, for an interview discussing the incredible journey Matt has been on within this Fandom. As Matt recalled starting his journey in a library, making Theoryland.com, doing beta-reads for Towers of Midnight and now hosting a successful YouTube livestream, little did he know that later in the interview he would be pleading "Can you just ask me about Lanfear?!"

fields.title: Episode 4: Much Ji - Why is Everyone so Awesome?

As always, they made lists, and Grace put on her academic hat as they dissected this question—a question they were nervous and excited about exploring because it was one of the first topics of interest they identified when they decided to start this podcast.

fields.title: Episode 3: The Gleeman - How the Fandom Brings Us Joy
fields.description:
Brian The Gleeman joins Anas and Grace as they recount how the Fandom has brought so much joy back into their lives. Meeting at conventions has been one of the most joyous moments this year, and they reflect on their most recent meeting at OgierCon—a gathering of fans in a Black Ajah style mansion in Charleston, SC for the book release event for Origins of The Wheel of Time by Michael Livinsgton, Harriet McDougal and Maria Simons.

fields.title: Episode 2: Rebirth - How the Fandom has Changed Our Lives
fields.description:
**SPOILERS for LOTR Rings of Power Episode 7 (1:09-1:11)**

In this second episode, Anas and Grace dive into all the different ways the Wheel of Time Fandom has changed their lives—overwhelmingly, and in such a positive way. In their reflection, they are surprised at how much of an effect this community has had on them and how grateful they are for all the changes; even for the overabundance of black t-shirts and mugs.

fields.title: The Light's Work Teaser
fields.description: This teaser is an introduction to The Light's Work - A Wheel of Time Fandom Podcast. It contains snippets of conversation between the two hosts, Anas and Grace, as they discuss the Healing power of The Wheel of Time fandom and their obsession with creating and amplifying great fandom moments. The first episode will be released on Sunday, November 6th 2022.

fields.title: Episode 311: Noal in the Tower of Ghenjei with a Machine Gun
fields.description:
We couldn't end EHR without answering a few important questions, like: How did idiots like us stumble into podcasting success? What happens now? What happens to the website? And, of course, which Wheel of Time character should have a gun?
 

EHR Substack

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 310: Mister Character Development
fields.description:
With no more chapters to summarize, it's just us and a Rainforest Cafe-themed novelty light-up cup, trying to decide whether and by what metrics Wheel of Time is a successful series.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 309: Randorin
fields.description:
Alright, who put "body swap" on their bingo card? We read the epilogue and talk about who else should have (actually) died, the possible Heroes of the Horn Polycule, Better Amyrlins Than Cadsuane (Literally anyone), Rand Uchiha, and ... God??

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 308: The Germ Theory of Disease
fields.description:
We've reentered Flop City with ch. 45–49. This rushed sequence manages to both under-explain and over-explain itself, and would it really be a Wheel of Time climax if there wasn't misogyny? At least we have Gaul's SWAT team of wolves and Moridin getting his Darth Maul on.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 307: Call Me Mishraile
fields.description:
Ch. 42–44 are packed with character development ... that has already happened! We talk about All the Dads Dying, Logain Inventing CPS, Horn of Valere Orientation, Asexual Artur Hawkwing, and Thom's, uh, Interesting Word Choice.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 306: Lady Corpse-a-Lot
fields.description:
Ch. 38–41 are emotional and climactic but largely flopped for us. Why can't Rand stop ascending to godhood? Why does everyone want Lan to be Aragorn? Why is The Beautiful Shendla here? We have these and other questions.
 
Transcript

fields.title: Episode 305: We Could've Had Girl Nuke
fields.description:
R.I.P. to, uh, everyone? Not really, but close. We finish ch. 37 and talk about the Hurinspital, how Wheel of Time is trying to be Game of Thrones, the Barbenheimer sequel, a possible Lews Therin jumpscare, and how at least Demandred Has Hobbies.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 304: Horse Crimes
fields.description:
R.I.P. to the best character in the series (Bela the horse). Unfortunately she died in service of the worst subplot in the series. We discuss Choice vs. Fate Philosophy, how Talmanes Is In a Saw Trap, Getting a Death Notice from a Wolf, and Playing Evil Catch with My Evil Son.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 303: How Many Eight-Year-Olds Does It Take to Tie a Tourniquet?
fields.description:
Why are children on this battlefield? Inquiring minds want to know. We talk about Belinda, Brando Sando Power Activate, Berelain's Herspital, Demandred's Balefire Gun, Shendla's Snipe List, Upgrading to a Lesbian Warder, and Artur Hawkwing as a Mean Bisexual.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 302: Demandred's Situationship
fields.description:
Somehow Demandred has time to ... date? We're confused. As we dive deeper into chapter 37, we talk about Chad Galad's Autistic Rizz, Logain Believes in Logain, Canonical "It" Pronouns, Fantasy Slurs, and whether upping the stakes is effective anymore.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 301: Rhuarc Has Been DILF-Certified
fields.description:
He's also been Taken (TM) by Graendal, so that's bad, but it's nice to know he's hot. Also in this episode: Girl Don't Touch Your Face, Siuan Is Retiring Tomorrow, Uno the Chaperone, X-Men Talents, and Pevara's Stanley Cup.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 300: Q&A Round-up
fields.description:
We're taking a break from the Last Battle to look back — and forward — using your fine, prime vintage questions in this extra-special, extra-long episode. Also, we decide who we'd f***, marry, and kill between Ishamael, Moghedien, and Asmodean (answers may surprise you).

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 299: The Alpacalypse
fields.description:
We start this episode with a long talk about swinging and end with llama-based horror. The first section of ch. 37 includes Freak TikTok, Classic Man Behaviors, Anxiety Telepathy, and a Boring Hell Dimension.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 298: The Flavor-Blasted Lands
fields.description:
We're so close to the Last Battle proper! For ch. 35–36, we discuss Quadrutiary Characters, the Stupidest Faile Decision of All Time, the Second Yeeting of the Horn of Valere, the Last Map, and Unspeakable Broth Facts.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 297: Olympic Boob Athletes
fields.description:
It's ch. 33–34, and at this point we are begging for Slayer to have an anime makeover and become a compelling villain. We talk about Bullying/Objectifying Men, Ocean's FedEx, the Third Gavroche Episode in a Row, and Double Lobotomies.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 296: Taken by Wolves (Erotic)
fields.description:
Is this book romantasy all of a sudden? Ch. 31–32 have that Old Man Love Story, Trebuchet v. Trebuchet, Traveling Zoom Calls, Beefing It at the Finish Line, Bryne's Cry for Help, and Galgan's Lingerie.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 295: Candlemaker Seppuku
fields.description:
Ch. 28–30 are frustrating and repetitive. We talk about Lan's Lobotomy, Edgelord Moridin, Cringe Gateways, Logain's Dramatic Entrances, Mr. Gavroche, and how the Impotence Metaphor Has Gone Too Far.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 294: The First-Ever Thawed Wife
fields.description:
Ch. 26–27 have us thinking that maybe some wives would be better off fridged. We also talk about Gawyn's Thousand Typewriters, Egwene with a Steel Chair, Boob Honks, Letting Evil Bashere Cook, and Deus Ex Fallen Raken.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 293: Lanfearance
fields.description:
It's both Lanfear-appearance and Lanfear-interference (same thing). For ch. 24–25, we talk about the Rod Holder, Theoden King Wannabes, the Power of God and Anime, the Moridin Pieta, and we ask: Where's the Jingle-Jangle of It All?

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 292: The Cringe to Gay Forsaken Spectrum
fields.description:
Ch. 22–23 may make real Wheel of Time scholars out of us. We talk about the Shemandreds, a "Phantom Menace" Version of Demandred, how Lanfear's Job Here Is Done, the Failed Evil Plans Badge, and Moiraine's AK-47.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 291: Jingle Jangle It's the Dark One
fields.description:
He's just a little guy! Anyway, for ch. 20–21, we're Going Off the Map (in a bad way). Also, Demandred Is a Dumpling, Egg's Got That Dog in Her, It's Lobotomy Tent: Part Two, and Androl Fails to Ocean's Eleven Us. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 290: Happy Pride to Bald Hair
fields.description:
Okay, his name's Baldhere, but Bald Hair is funnier. For ch. 18–19, we talk about how Everybody Hates Jonny Fairplay, the Definition of Tragedy, Rand's Identity Theft, Agelmar Almost Using the Pope Slur, Gawyn's Incest Panic, and Mat's Princess Diaries Moment.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 289: R.I.P. Deepe
fields.description:
For ch. 16–17, we go through some of Wheel of Time's Worst Hits: Grass and Manslaughter (It's Ecofascism!), He's Got That Horse In Him, Dark One Gunk, Min's Two Tasks, and Rand's Orpheus Swag. It's a cringe compilation, y'all.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 288: R.I.P. Rand's Hand (But Not Mat's Eye)
fields.description:
Those disability politics just can't be consistent, huh? For ch. 14–15, we talk about Sidekick Gaul, Getting ROOTED, Willpower Saving the Day, A Bit of Actual Romance, and Don't It Always Seem to Go?

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 287: R.I.P. Perrin's 94 Dead Relatives
fields.description:
For ch. 11–13, we talk about Mmsexy Tingling, Retconning Mat's Time in Ebou Dar, Mazrim Taim's Supervillain Resume (he got the job!), Lanfear Closure, Padan Fain Un-Closure, the Trolloc Meat Grinder, and the Hater Zone.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 286: R.I.P. Bulen
fields.description:
Who's Bulen? Who cares? For ch. 9–10, we talk about Helvetica Lord of the Rings, the Epic Highs and Lows of Warfare, Citing Scripture ("Artemis Fowl"), Captain Planet Narishma, Lan's End, Basement Time with Androl, and French Mime War Profiteering.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 285: R.I.P. The Entire City of Caemlyn
fields.description:
Ch. 7–8 take us into the next stage of this book: prolonged warfare. We talk about Rebel With Claws, UN Meeting Bouncer, a Damocles' Sword but Positive, the Bond of Brotherhood, the Horn of Valere Heist, and our Upcoming Bones Podcast. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 284: R.I.P. Darlin's Sanity
fields.description:
Ch. 5–6 take us to the fantasy U.N. summit, and it could only be more Jordan-ish if there were nude women for no reason. We talk about Official Court Spankings, the Aiel as Cops, Rand's Unrealistic Goals, Egg Throwing Shoes, and the Literal Four Horsemen.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 283: R.I.P. Those "Unconscious" Asha'man
fields.description:
Chapters 3–4 are here! We talk about Sports Polyamory (the ideal polyamory), "Frankenskank," Characters' Wild Priorities, Rand and Moridin Touching "Balefire," Checking Off Romance Boxes, and Women's Piss Mazes. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 282: R.I.P. Talmanes (PSYCH!)
fields.description:
We're off to a pretty slow start with ch. 1–2. We get more of Rand's Weird Era, not to mention his Deadbeat Dad Era (the cat's in the cradle ...), plus the Arousal/Anger Constant, Black Tower Propaganda, Androl Is Bella Swan, and a whole lot of Genre Confusion.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 281: R.I.P. Darrell K. Sweet
fields.description:
We read the prologue (yes, the entire prologue) of AMoL and talk about pacing and heroism, plus Sally's Psychic Powers, Rand's Tibetan Sky Burial, New Sword Move: Piss Your Pants, the Sequel to "The Village," and the Myrddraal Breakroom.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 280: Don't You Want to Rescue Me?
fields.description: We finish up ToM with celebrations of Gawyn's Puka Shell Necklace, Pevara's Hut, the Tower of Ghenjei Locksmith, Graendal's Turbo Hell, and Olver's Mail Fraud, while condemning how ultimately pointless Moiraine's "death" was.

fields.title: Episode 279: A Creepily Slow Rendition of "Bad Romance"
fields.description:
Welcome to the Tower of Ghenjei! Is that David Bowie? For ch. 53–55, we talk about the Need to Be Told "No," Gay Old Dens, Helm's Deep Recruitment, the Finn Serving You-Know-What, Dune Box Mist, and Melodramatic Screaming. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 278: The 9/11 Episode of "Bones"
fields.description: For ch. 50–52, we talk about Elayne's Bobby Fischer Political Move, her Pet Frenchmen, Libel/Slander Against Lews Therin, the Little Sun Tzu in Emily's Brain, Uber Driver Perrin, and B. Sanderson's Inversion of Terry Pratchett's "Boots Theory."

fields.title: Episode 277: Babies Channeling
fields.description:
You know, like balefire, from their eyeballs? Like laser vision? Anyway. For ch. 48–49 we discuss how Everything is the Aiel's Fault, Rand's Mega Sperm, Asmodean Moiraine, and the Cowboy Lightbringers.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 276: Hashtag Love Wins
fields.description:
Ch. 45–47 are great for representation: representation of insufferable politicians (Elayne), men who wear unnecessary disguises (Galad), "cool" nerds (Androl), men who hate the club (Perrin), and people who should just be murdered (Mazrim Taim, Tuon).

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 275: King Virgin and Queen Slut
fields.description:
Who wants to bet on whether this title ends up censored? For ch. 42–44, we talk about Feelings Impermanence, Marriage Bumpers, Prince Loser, the New Kardashians, and Failed Nostalgia.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 274: Perrin's Feelings Exhibition
fields.description:
Despite the title, ch. 39–41 are action-packed (though sadly there is no battlefield kissing). Discussion includes: We Need More Explosions, Getting Right with God, IKEA Pack-It-Up Forges, Galad's Deprogramming, and Who Is Nakomi Plaza?

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 273: The First Canine Fridging
fields.description:
RIP to a (arguably the only) real one. For ch. 36–38, we talk about how Perrin Is a Mary Sue; we accompany Egg to a Work Meeting; someone floats on the ceiling Mary Winchester-Style; and we discuss the fantasy Ethics of Killing.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 272: Perrin's Ted Bundy Strategy
fields.description: This isn't the trial of the century, the year, or even the minute, but it's a trial. For ch. 34–35, we talk about Dannil the Danimal, Mr. Integrity, "Bad Apple" Byar, the False Good/Evil Dichotomy, and ask: Where Are the Lawyers?

fields.title: Episode 271: The Most Man
fields.description:
Discussion topics for ch. 31–33 include: Chekhov's Abyss, Final Girl Ituralde, Respawning Trollocs, the Dragon Reborn's Walk with Christ, Our Favorite Monarch, and Gawyn and Elayne's Folgers Commercial (you know the one). 
 
Transcript

fields.title: Episode 270: Get in the Purple Zone
fields.description:
Welcome to 2024! For ch. 28–30, we're talking about Big Boy Vitamins, how Telepathy Is the Obvious Answer, Rhyming Perrin, Letting Galad Be a Side Character, and the Most Bizarre Scene of All Time. Also, are Grady and Neald, like, SO hot now?

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 269: There's Always a Jack the Ripper
fields.description:
Ch. 25–27 are disappointing to say the least. First, Rand faces no consequences for his crimes, but don't worry; according to Min, he's done nothing wrong. Then Perrin has the same epiphany for the 98th time. Berelain's boobs corrupt Galad. And the Hall of the Tower, as usual, is swooning.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 268: Defund Paw Patrol
fields.description:
You want to know about ch. 22–24, you say? Well, they're all about Sally's Exploding Bones, Good Old Chub, Chance Boy Himself, Weird Uncle Mat, and Hysteria in Tel'aran'rhiod. Also: What About the Sheep?

  • Transcript

fields.title: Episode 267: Mom Said It's My Turn at the Front of the Phalanx
fields.description:
There's a lot to discuss in ch. 20–21, including Vagina Mirrors, Ethics Boards, the Slippery Slope of Magic Nukes, how Single Women Are an Invasive Species, and, hey, Whoa, Balwer Isn't Just a Secretary?

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 266: The Elayne/Farquaad Similarities
fields.description:
"Some of you may die, but that's a sacrifice I'm willing to make." Ch. 17–19 get us talking about Code Brando, Berelain Said Boobily, Something That Is Nothing, OUR Amyrlin Seat, and Brandon Sanderson's straight guy heroism.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 265: Näeff
fields.description:
For ch. 14–16, we talk about Three Girlbosses and their Psychological Warfare, Flat Characters, Black Tower Volleyball, the Horror Story that is Rand's Brain, Forsaken Trading Cards, and Anything for Hubby.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 264: This Is My Fight Song
fields.description:
Ch. 11–13 are short, but we find a way to work in all the following discussion topics: Magicians, how Elayne's Pregnancy Was Written by Men, Rand's Jesus Robe, Appropriate Public vs. Private Behavior, Darkfriend Vision, and Min's Birdbrain.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 263: I Love My Ugly Son
fields.description:
For ch. 7–10, we talk about Lan's Minion, Buford; Neald's Queer-Coded Joie de Vivre; and Grady's Denied Time Off Request; and we bid farewell to a real one, Lopin. Also, welcome to Sedona, Arizona.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 262: Go to Therapy, Mr. Stag
fields.description:
For ch. 4–6, we have problems with fictional men, including Gawyn's Incel Behavior and reboot of CSI: Tar Valon; Galad's KKK Era; and Perrin's Leadership Hypocrisy. We also have problems with the real men doing construction outside our house: apologies for the noise!

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 261: TikTok Empath Energy
fields.description:
In ch. 1–3, Rand enters his Wellness Influencer era. We also talk about getting Bubbled of Eviled, Perrin's Pointless Crossroads (a recurring theme), Torture Junior's Throuple, and Double Shielding.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 260: Hello, Heretic
fields.description:
Welcome to Towers of Midnight! Don't worry, Emily references the Da Vinci Code for the second week in a row. We talk about the cover and prologue, including how Mat Has Never Held a Bag Before, Lan Rhymes with "Man," There's Warging Now??, and Toilet Spoon.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 259: He Doesn't Even Climb the Mountain
fields.description:
We finish The Gathering Storm by talking about Rand stumbling his way through enlightenment. We discuss how Everyone Is Happy Under Fascism, the Most Fridged Woman Ever (Ilyena), Privileged Enlightenment, and how you should just Watch the Da Vinci Code.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 258: Callandor Turns Into a Gun, Actually
fields.description:
Here's how Callandor can still win. For ch. 47–48, we talk about Guarding Empty Rooms and Empty Tables, Verbally Hugging, Self-Contained Enlightenment, and the dream scenario in which Mat Is Empress.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 257: Five Guys Beheadings and Fries
fields.description:
In ch. 45–46, Egg consolidates power in the White Tower, and we talk about the important things: Monsieur Michelin, the Bloodest Reddest Gown, Only Boobs Allowed, the White Cavern, and our Patented Easiest Way to Get Babes.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 256: Get Squashed, Idiot
fields.description:
The tagline for ch. 43–44 should be: Pwease, No Bombs. We also talk about Gawyn's Imagined Chivalric Romance, Sittergate, Hurin's Cameo Appearance, Rand's Box Obsession, and Tam's Two (2) Parenting Failures.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 255: Timothee Chalamet Vaping in the Vatican
fields.description:
What if the young pope was younger? For ch. 41–42, we ask this vital question and discuss these topics: Charlz and Chubain OTP, Gawyn Winning the Partnership, Dubcon Romance Tropes, and the Return of the King.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 254: Still Got Two Wives
fields.description:
With ch. 39–40, we talk about Verin's "galactic"-level slay (or is it?), the most compelling Warder (Tomas), Egwene's virgin procession, and Siuan and Gareth's terminal heterosexuality. Plus, what if Elayne was a secret Darkfriend?

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 253: The Dragon Reborn's Court Jester
fields.description:
For ch. 37–38, we, ahem, define crimes against humanity. We also talk about Sammael's Cube Con 2000, EnlightenmentGate, how Needing Therapy Doesn't Make Up for the Atrocities, and Rand's Legal Abyss.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 252: Will Poulter
fields.description:
For ch. 35–36, we talk about (really): Appropriate Wonka Sociopathy, Gender Reveal Magic, how Icarus Got Stabbed by Padan Fain, Bad Dramatic Irony, and Losing Trickster Points. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 251: You'll Never Guess What Was at the Mattress Supply Store
fields.description:
Really, you won't. For ch. 32–34, we talk about Improving Nynaeve, Making Excuses for Rand, Consequence-Free Tyranny, Redemption Arcs, and Star Wars Spoilers.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 250: Comrade Titties
fields.description:
You shouldn't trust the ho's in ch. 29–30, which is ... every woman. We talk about Our Bestie, Colonialism; Rand's Dead Fish Eyes; Titty Redistribution; Not-Chili's; and the Nuclear Fanny Pack, and we Send in the Clowns.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 249: On This Episode of Supernatural ...
fields.description:
Okay, okay, it's actually ch. 27–28 of the Gathering Storm. We talk about Busty Beauties, the Romantic Poets, Repeat Plots, Wescuing Women, and the various Flavors of Misogynist Humor.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 248: Alpha-Core Gawyn
fields.description:
In ch. 24–26, Gawyn is here to teach these betas a lesson about MANHOOD. Too bad Gareth Bryne won't spank him. We also talk about the Shape of Bubbles, Vegan Aes Sedai, and Chivalric Knights, and ask: Where Is All the Multicultural Curiosity?

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 247: The Hardboy Scale
fields.description:
Ch. 22–23 are all about Rand's feelings, because men's feelings are WAY more important than women's. We talk about how He Needs to Be Harder, Daddy; Egregious Deus Ex Machina, the Scientific Method, and give a Shoutout to Martha. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 246: Goat Girl Summer
fields.description:
Well, well, if it isn't the infamous "women are like goats" speech. For ch. 20–21, we'll talk about goat pride; the difference between tricksters, fools, and comic relief; and the world's weirdest to-do list.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 245: Lying Greg
fields.description:
For ch. 17–19, we talk about the Plot Twist of the Century, how Siuan Is an Army Wife, the Cult Besties, Gambit from X-Men's Appearance, Court Jester Mat, and the Pariah Parade.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 244: Elon or Ellen
fields.description:
There's an unbelievable amount of stupidity in ch. 15–16, and it's not just us mispronouncing Moridin's real name. We also talk about Balefire Life Hacks, Katerine's Evil Laugh, and Laras's Underground Railroad.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 243: Sleete Watch 2023
fields.description:
In our discussion of ch. 12–14, we talk about the (Nonexistent) Peer-Reviewed Forkroot Study, Seeing the Blueprint, Gawyn's Purity Ring, how Cadsuane Has the Nuclear Launch Codes, and Elaida Unshived.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 242: Banner v. No Banner: Dawn of Justice
fields.description:
For ch. 9–11, we talk about Grady's One-Punch Kill, Matching Form and Content, Enjoying the Mat Pedestal While We Still Can, Tylee's Motorola Razor, Ituralde's Character Assassination, and Brian??

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 241: Five Generals' Group Chat
fields.description:
Pedron Niall is left on read, obviously. For ch. 6–8, we ask: Why So Insular? and discuss Lanfear's Best Disguise, Two Short Kings, Beloved Point of View Characters, and the Introverted Route.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 240: Javert Era, or Javerta
fields.description:
For ch. 3–5, we talk about Eating Tums Like Candy, White Man Names, this brand new thing (Character Arcs), the Final Evolution of Girlboss, Brandon Sanderson's Blorbo, and a potential Asha'man PR Campaign.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 239: No More Situations, Please
fields.description:
In chapters 1–2, we take a close look at the Brobert Janderson style and talk about Increased Mediation, the Perfect Wifey, Two Ways to Get a Doctorate, and how Women Be Crying.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 238: Robert Jordan's School of Fantasy Naming Conventions
fields.description:
Welcome to the dawn of Brando Sando! After reading this blissfully short prologue, we discuss Aviendha's Six Pounds of Mascara, Rand's Jeans, the Seanchan Political Spectrum, a Trolloc Reminder, and Zaddy Ituralde.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 237: Great at the Military
fields.description:
We finish our coverage of Knife of Dreams with discussion of '07 Throwbacks, how Gremlin Vibes Are Sexy, Fainting Goats, Embodied Empire, Red Flag City, and Narrative Delaying Tactics. On to the Era of Branderson!

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 236: DOUG
fields.description:
In ch. 33–35, we take another stop on Robert Jordan's Gratification Ferris Wheel. We also talk about Torture Politics, how Sammael Was SUCH a Loser, Diplomatic Train Wrecks, and how the Seanchan are Absolutely Besieged.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 235: Who Needs Therapy? Have a Sword
fields.description:
There are lots of bad decisions in ch. 31–32, including, possibly, our choice to read them. We discuss Climax Squared, Worldbuilding Gymnastics, and Carrie Bradshaw Armor and ask: Is This Your Card?

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 234: Hammers Build Homes
fields.description:
We're finally at Malden, but the downward spiral continues. For ch. 28–30, we talk about a Loony Tunes Trap, Perrin's Mass Execution Plan, "Romantic" Persistence, a Marriage of Equals, and Your Friendly Neighborhood Fascist.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 233: Pony Elevator
fields.description:
Ch. 26–27 are all over the place, but we managed to nerd out about crossbow cranks, then talk about Defamiliarization, Disney Villain Coding, Grady's Smoke Brake, and Semirhage's Peer-Reviewed Diagnosis.

Transcript 233

fields.title: Episode 232: Feel Bad? Just Don't!
fields.description:
Ch. 24–25 bring us back to Egg, which means we're Deconstructing the Girlboss. We're also talking about WoT's Preservation of the Status Quo, a Haunted Bog Full of Perrin, Elaida's Laser Brain, and RJ's latest Hate Crime against Talmanes.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 231: Greg McKraken III
fields.description:
Ch. 22–23 deal with some heavy topics! Be prepared for discussions of mass suicide. We'll also talk about RJ's overall project of an apocalyptic narrative and how, believe it or not, Supernatural did it better. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 230: Who Sent the Trollocs??
fields.description:
This question and more will NOT be answered in our discussion of ch. 20-21. Instead, we'll talk about Nynaeve's Fey Trickery, Lan's "Mental Health" Regression, Demandred's Perfect World, and Cadsuane's Ineffective Parenting.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 229: Tee Hee, Women Are Mean
fields.description:
In ch. 18–19, we talk about how Dragons are Cats and Griffins are Dogs, Improv Game of Thrones, Newton's Fourth Law, how Rand Is a Victim of Prophecy, Two Salts, and how Sally Saved Someone's Marriage. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 228: Samwil Kill God
fields.description:
We're getting academic with ch. 15-17, talking about Point of View Exhaustion, Robert Jordan's repeated Violations of Game Mechanics, and how this whole thing is beginning to feel like Season 13 of Supernatural.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 227: A Billion Bees and Four Feral Raccoons
fields.description:
Discussion topics from ch. 12-14 include: RJ Peppering in Some Plagues, Spell of No Blood, Let Bygones Be Guybons, our Beef with the Trolley Problem, and Elayne Girlbossing Too Close to the Sun.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 226: Snakez in the House
fields.description:
Ch. 10-11 are over, but Valan Luca's romance with the Dark One is eternal. Other topics include: the Sexual Dynamics of the 'Finn, Bard Powers, how Memory Is Finite, Endorsement vs. Interrogation, and Mat Cauthon: Noted Law Keeper.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 225: Brett the Aelfinn
fields.description:
Ch. 8–9 of Knife of Dreams are NSFT (Not Safe for Telepathy). We'll be talking about RJ's tendency to use Quantity Over Quality, Dragon Cloaca, and the Drudgery of Socks. Plus, the EHR canon expands with Larry the Trolloc's new love interest!

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 224: Zorse
fields.description:
Since ch. 6-7 include an infamous Spanking Scene, we mostly talk about zebras and goats in this one. Topics include: Zebras Are Worse Horses, Howdy Hats, Visit a Goat-Infested Island, and Teslyn Joining the A-Team.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 223: The Santa Gene
fields.description:
In our somewhat brief coverage of ch. 4-5, we talk about the Himbo to Santa Pipeline, Aram's Cult Membership Record, Yet Another Permission Slip, Casting Sevanna, and how Emily Is a Guest in Her Own Home. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 222: Forsaken, LLC
fields.description:
After a week to recuperate, we're back with the first three chapters of Knife of Dreams! These chapters include Net Zero Pacing Points, Neverending Foreplay, Prison Tent, and Graendal's Christmas Newsletter.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 221: There's a Gas Leak in Perrin's Subplot
fields.description:
In this episode, we finish detailing Robert Jordan's prologue crimes and discuss Alviarin's Eviction, Neald's Magic Holes, A Million Alyses/Aliases, Principal Silviana, and how We All Have the Same 24 Hours.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 220: What, Like It's Hard?
fields.description:
Welcome to Knife of Dreams! As we discuss the first half of the prologue, we talk about Darrell K. Sweet's Arm Zone, Compatible Stabbing, Galad's CTR Ring, RJ's Crime Scale, Efficient Evil, and Pevera Should Have a Gun.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 219: Gawyn Trakand: Mall Cop
fields.description:
It's the twilight of Crossroads of Twilight! As we finish book 10 and season 9, we talk about Opium and Lord Byron, Chickens Unionizing, Egg's Cotton Candy Vape, Bode's Daring Tar Valon Escape, and the arrival of our Brando Period.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 218: Beeping Up with the Basheres
fields.description: The crevasse just gets deeper in ch. 28-29, straight to hell. We talk about Robert Jordan's false narrative promises, restorative vs. practical justice, and the fallacy of equality in Mat's courtship of Tuon.

fields.title: Episode 217: Hey, Ear Guy?
fields.description:
We're headed into the crevasse: ch. 25-27. We talk about Neald's Showmanship, Upsetting Setting, Moralizing Bad Hygiene, All Shoulder Devils, Terminal Uniqueness, and Tallanvor's Emotional Journey Beard.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 216: Queue Fast Queue Furious
fields.description:
We're back with Rand in ch. 23-24, and as usual he's making bad decisions. We talk about Matchmaking, It 2: The Queue, World Conquering To-Do Lists, Diplomatic Ouchies, and the Late Late Night Show with Mazrim Taim.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 215: Barf Phase
fields.description:
Chapters 20-22 have some prime examples of Robert Jordan's worst writing, including the torture of women, transphobia, and a whole lot of miscommunication. Plus his favorite way to characterize bad guys: as incompetent middle managers. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 214: Chess with LeBron James
fields.description:
We kick off this episode with some signature EHR Anti-Monarchial Vitriol, then actually talk about ch. 18-19, with discussions about Lore as Gate-Keeping, The Dangers of Feminism, Olver's Pony Express, and Vulture Culture.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 213: Hate to Agree with Gareth Bryne
fields.description:
We really, really do. Ch. 16-17 are all about Egg, who we haven't talked about in a while! We discuss her Intellectual Theft, Manufactured Incompetence, Delana (Whomst We Hate), and how maybe Egg should just ... Let Siuan Do Murder.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 212: Birds or Death
fields.description:
Ch. 14-15 continue the trend in EHR's twilight years: It's All Bad. We talk about Class Warfare in Caemlyn, the Least Dangerous Game (women), Inconvenient Bodies, and finally say goodbye to the Day That God Forgot.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 211: A Caucasian Blob
fields.description:
Ah, the infamous eight-page bath. For ch. 12-13 we talk about Brandon Sanderson's Game of Thrones, Bad Genes/Jeans, Hers and Hers Bathtubs, More Sea Folk Racism, and Gender Moments with Robert Jordan.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 210: Keep 'Em Guessing
fields.description:
In this short episode, we devote about eight minutes to ch. 10-11 (they're boring) and the other twenty to RJ's Plot Gymnastics, Gojo Trigger Warning, a Forgotten D.A.R.E. Song, and how Ed is a Time-Traveling Warlock.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 209: Everything Is Still Bad and Awful
fields.description:
Head's up: Chapter 9 deals with a lot of troubling content, including sexual assault, consent in captivity, and even racism, and that's pretty much all we talk about in this episode. Skip it as needed for your mental well-being.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 208: Airing of Grievances
fields.description:
Just brace yourself, because our discussion of ch. 7-8 is mostly (justified) complaining. We talk about Masuri Winchester, Nice Teacher Supremacy, how Naruto Did It Better, and how Grady and Neald Should Unionize.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 207: It's Homer with a Steel Chair!
fields.description:
What else would we talk about for 30 minutes while covering ch. 5-6 than whether Aram is in love with Perrin? (Probably not.) Other topics include: Hospital Swag Bag, Literary Cage Match, and Roy Mustang: A Feminist??

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 206: Rate Us on Yelp
fields.description: This episode is about ten minutes of ch. 3-4 coverage and 30 minutes of tangents, including: Stupid Men Sexy, Tybalt's Barf Bag Fiasco, Naming Appliances, and How Not to Fall for Copaganda. Enjoy.

fields.title: Episode 205: Wiener Dog Cafe
fields.description:
In ch. 1-2, we're on a downhill slope into RJ's pro-Seanchan agenda. More cheerful discussion topics include: Boyz in the Tentz, Valan Luca's Disguise Chest, Forgotten Subplots, Thom the Monarch Serial Killer, and Noal's Fishcapades.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 204: Poverty-Stricken in Cheese Town
fields.description:
While covering the rest of the prologue, how many times do you think we say "What's frustrating about Gawyn is ..."? (Hint: It's a lot.) We also discuss Gawyn's Sexual Mind Palace, Flat Earther Gawyn, JFK's Famous Saying About Cults, and Angst de Vivre.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 203: An Ugly Boy Who Can Do It All
fields.description:
We're back with book 10, babes! The first half of the prologue is all about Mat's Pilgrim Hat, Covert Art Cocaine, Ituralde Causing the Feminism to Leave Our Bodies, and Mazrim Taim's Very Special Classes for Very Special Boys.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 202: THE CLAW
fields.description:
For the final chapter of Winter's Fart, I mean Heart, we're talking about technicality vs. ambiguity in magic systems, Rand's Trauma Plateau, that Narishma Is a Gun, and Tybalt's Safety Cabinet.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 201: Deus Ex Padan Fain
fields.description:
These last few Far Madding chapters (32-34) are just as confusing as those that came before. Discussion points include: Lews Therin's Cockney Accent, Archetype Prison, Lan Being a Good Husband, Mail Fraud, and Narishma Being Threateningly Hot.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 200: Arson Lite, for Men
fields.description:
Episode 200 (ch. 30-31) is pretty standard EHR. We just talk about normal topics, like the Dawn of Branderson, Nerim and Lopin's Enemies to Lovers AU, Human Xanax, Narrative Punishment vs. Authorial Punishment, and Tracking Mat's Character Assassination.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 199: A Vat of Dragons
fields.description:
What's worse than a can of worms? For ch. 28-29, we talk about King Arthur: Legend of the Sword Montages, a Trio of Rogues, how There Must Always Be a Ringmaster, Beslan Is the Only Character in a Musical, and Mat's Knife Days.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 198: It's Been ... ONE WEEK
fields.description:
Here are the takeaways from ch. 26-27: Women Can Only Do Three Things. They Were Roommates. RJ is Scavenging Suspense. Elayne Is the Worst Secretary. Birgitte Loves Her Ugly Wife.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 197: The Mona Sheep-a
fields.description:
In ch. 24-25, we're still in Far Madding, City of Lost Opportunities. We talk about how Cadsuane is a Sleep Paralysis Demon, the Forsaken Staff Meetings, Rand's Mish Imposs, and the ultimate improvement on Wheely Time: Narishma Just Leaves.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 196: Rand IS the Baba Yaga
fields.description:
Ch. 22-23 are the first part of Winter's Heart's most baffling sequence. We talk about Crooked Vaginas, Rand's Agatha Christie Murder Trail, Hot Topic Chic, and how the Far Madding plot failed to execute on any of its potential.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 195: Suroth in Falme with a Candlestick
fields.description:
In our coverage of ch. 19-21, we talk about the Cons of Limited Omniscient Narrations, the Pioneer Woman's Crimes Against Humanity, whether evoking genocide imagery works in WoT, and we ask: Where Are All the Good Jolines?

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 194: What Does the Fox Man Say?
fields.description:
For ch. 17-18 of Winter's Heart, we talk about 2 Horse 2 Furious, Humiliation and Gaslighting, New York Times Bestselling Author Jain Farstrider, and Hades Kidnapping Hades. There's a lot going on!

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 193: Mat's Rhythmic Gymnastics Routine
fields.description:
Thank God for Mat point of views! Sure, he's in Seanchan-occupied Ebou Dar, but we'll take what we can get. For ch. 15-16 of Winterception's Heart, we talk about Riddles and Hungry Tricksters, Valan Luca Being a Sitcom Dad, and Mat Being a Horse Girl.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 192: The Rat Is King
fields.description:
For the very problematic chapters 13-14, we talk about Communist Leanings, Cadsuane's JurisDICKtion, being Stuck in the Pushing Children Out of Windows Stage of Development. Plus, of course, Moridin's rat.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 191: The Hero's Journey, For Her
fields.description:
Talking about these chapters required something ... special. Luckily Bobert was willing to help us out. Discussion points include: Alligators Climbing Fences, a Million Billion Pieces, the Bible as a Marriage Guide, and Freud Being a Huge Feminist.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 190: Hatchetface
fields.description:
No, this one's not related to Gary Paulsen's seminal work, "Hatchet." For ch. 9-10, we discuss how lots of people have French dads, Elayne's dieting fixation, and everyone's least favorite character, who should've just stayed locked in Robert Jordan's brain.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 189: There Are Rocks Everywhere
fields.description:
This episode is long, but only because we have to talk about Path of Daggers. :( For ch. 7-8, we discuss Deprogramming the Seanchan, the Princess in Disguise Trope, Balwer and Norry (the Ultimate Power Couple), and Lan's Borat Voice.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 188: How Not to Win a Guy in Ten Days
fields.description:
For ch. 5-6, we're talking about Fast and Furious: Hopper Drift, Untrustworthy Women, the World's Longest Misogyny Manifesto, the Shaido Blob, and the Three Genders (women, children, blacksmiths).

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 187: Know the Snow ... Biblically
fields.description:
Ch. 3-4 of Winter's Heart are a mixed bag. On the one hand, Faile is doing her best. On the other hand, we have a Reverse Taken Situation, Sevanna Being a Material Girl, a Graendal Lite, if you will, and a whole lot of Genre Confusion.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 186: Find That Rat
fields.description:
Winter's Heart ch. 1-2 kick off Perrin's books-long kidnapped-wife arc. We dig into a few reasons why this arc is universally despised and talk about Magic FaceTime, Trauma Olympics, Shaido Tracking Chips, and Glorified Taxi Drivers.

  • Transcript

fields.title: Episode 185: That's Not Very Ally of You
fields.description:
Discussion topics for the second half of Winter's Heart's prologue include: Mandy Moore Has the Range; Hubris, Thy Name Is Elaida; Reverse Santa Claus; Grady and Neald Should Get a Gun; and Rand and Min Are Cute for Once???

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 184: Welcome to the Smack Dome
fields.description:
Welcome to our extra long, extra special season 8 premiere! We talk about Darrell K. Sweet's "Best" Work, Holding the Prologue Ransom, the Torture Chair, Caemlyn (the City of No Solutions), and Girl Power. Enjoy!

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 183: No Body, No Dead
fields.description:
For our season finale of Crown of Swords, we talk about how Sammael Beefed It, Sexism on Top of Sexism, Sentient Sock Puppets, the Sexual Tension Between Rand and Moridin, Deus ex Liah, and the Ideal Short King Threesome. It's a real party.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 182: NO BONES?!
fields.description:
This episode has no bones! Ha ha, no, that's just a funny joke. It's that dang gholam that's got no bones. For ch. 39-40, we also talk about a Lot of Twos, the Sorority from Hell, and the Artful Dodger Picking Olver up from Day Care.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 181: Top Ten Heroic Mat Moments
fields.description:
In ch. 37-38, Robert Jordan really tries to drag us into his sexism by making his female characters the absolute worst. Embroider this on a throw pillow: "Women don't have brains; they have babies."

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 180: Dickmaster 3000
fields.description:
Isn't it nice that the Dragon Reborn can't ever be killed because he's so tall and good at swords? Anyway, ch. 35-36 are bad. We talk about Francine Herbert, Magazine Cutout Women, and MVP Darlin. Also, Viva la Revolution.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 179: The Tallest Man Is in Charge
fields.description:
This episode includes some upsetting noises, and we're not just talking about every time Min opens her mouth. Ch 32-34 also include: Elaida Failing Upward, Sick History, Lollipops, and the Most '90s Feminism You've Ever Seen.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 178: A Side of Skeleton
fields.description:
This short-ish episode is brought to you by Shake Shack's Bag of Bones! For ch. 30-31, we talk about how Slapping (the Gender Inverse of Spanking), Teens in Charge, being Horny for Caligula, and Emily's Outlander Betrayal. As always, Love Wins.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 177: No Crickets Were Harmed in the Making of this Podcast
fields.description:
Please be mindful of the content warnings: In discussing ch. 28-29, we talk about sexual assault and domestic violence. Skip this one if you need to, and we'll catch you next time!

Transcript

Links:

South Valley Services Domestic Violence 101

Donate to South Valley Services 

Power and Control Wheel 

National Domestic Violence Hotline

Loveisrespect.org

fields.title: Episode 176: Mean Little Opinions Everywhere
fields.description:
Ch. 25-27 are not fun! They forced us to explain morality, if that tells you anything. Discussion topics include: Not Like the Other Myrddraal, Oscar Winner Rand al'Thor, Hit in the Face by a Plot Building, and the AU Where Grady's Wife Murders Mazrim Taim.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 175: Sharks and Vagrants
fields.description:
After our week off, we're pouring one out for the late, great Gary Paulsen. May Valhalla welcome you, Gary. We also discuss ch. 22-24, including debilitating Aes Sedai fetishes, how unnecessary the Kin are, and the latent misogyny of Nynaeve and Elayne's incompetence.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 174: Critically Acclaimed Sex Dungeon
fields.description:
Ch. 20-21 are all about cubes, cubes, cubes. We also call Sammael a Silly Little Goose, wonder where all the assassins are, and question Jordan's portrayal of one-sided loyalty in his so-called "friendships."

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 173: Only Real Ones Remember Cha-Cha
fields.description:
We're joined by long-time friend and WoT progenitor Cambria Valente to talk about ch. 18-19! Dicussion points include: Bisexual Chairs, Robot Jordan, F*cking on Broken Glass, and Berelain's Yelp Reviews.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 172: Mat's Terrible, Horrible, No-Good, Very Bad Eleven Days
fields.description:
With ch. 16-17, we wonder where all the ambassadors are, how many human years are in an Aes Sedai year, and who that mysterious note came from. Mat just tries to get a waffle.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 171: Elayne and Nynaeve Go to Clown College
fields.description:
We discuss everything about ch. 13-15. Everything: Nynaeve's Egg Complex, Dumb and Dumper Cops, the Blatant Racism in Aviendha's Point of View, Mat's Boyfriendz Group Chat, and who could forget Crunchy Munchy, the Court Jester?

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 170: Bimbic Inspiration
fields.description:
Sorry, the first 20 minutes of this are just a trip to Bummer Town. But hey, that's ch. 11-12. We also talk about Halima's Headache Weave, Dastardly Men, Blackmailing the Pope, and Getting Warders a Forever Home.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 169: "It's Over, Anakin! I Have the Ethical High Ground!"
fields.description:
Among other things, ch. 8-10 showed us how the Human Meat Grinder can be tracked directly back to Merana Losing Her Job. Other talking points include: CSI: Crecky's Garage, Daddy Satan, and the Forsaken Softball Competition.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 168: Rand's Errands Three
fields.description:
Chapters 6-7 force us to ask a lot of questions: Is Aram trying to "Single White Woman" Perrin? What is Rand's third errand? Why is he the human embodiment of a c*ck block? Does he really think the Asha'man (and Mat) are just glorified pigeons?

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 167: France, France
fields.description:
Our coverage of ch. 3-5 is day-old and stale, like the croissants paving the streets of Fantasy France. Due to an Audacity tragedy, we'll never have a joke as good as "I Went Through the Human Meat Grinder, and All I Got Was This T-Shirt" again, but we do our best.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 166: Murder Is Bad, Duh
fields.description:
The first two chapters of Crown of Swords are pretty, well ... bad. We discuss Rand and Perrin's inability to make different decisions, the Aragorn Filter, Paul Bettany's Bum, the Magical Honor System, and Rand's Gender-Neutral Pervert Radar.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 165: Would You Sacrifice the Hottest Man in the World?
fields.description:
The CoS prologue is dense, and so is this episode. We talk about the Hubris of Towers, the Fisher King, RJ's oblique references to "The Vileness," Gawyn's Telescope, the Anti-Balwer, and Little Popes.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 164: Sammael's Inglorious Death
fields.description:
We're back and reading the Crown of Swords! By way of introduction, we talk about Ghost Horses, Throwing Tropes at the Wall, Lady Saruman, the Magic People Saturation Point, Darrell K. Sweet's Sensory Deprivation Chamber, and an ... unsettling Lews Therin casting.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 163: Daddy's Little War Criminal
fields.description:
Lord of Chaos is finally over! Discussion topics of ch. 55 and the epilogue include: Emily's Last Words, the Faceless Horde of the Shaido, Magic Meat Grinder, the Sliding Scale of Ethics in Magic Warfare, and the ultimate question: Cannon or Gedwyn?

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 162: Travel-Sized Guillotine
fields.description:
This episode might get us canceled. For ch. 53-54, we talk about Teen Wolf Disease (Not Lycanthropy), Perrin's Mood Ring Nose, the Lobotomy Tent, how to Team Lift Your Marriage, and Shaido: Clone Wars.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 161: 2 Dragon 2 Born
fields.description:
Discussion points for ch. 51-52 include: Kidnapping Slam Dunk, Rand's Incel Vibes and his "Big Mommy Milkers" (thanks, TikTok), the Virgin Age, Snickers Commercial Lan, and the ongoing need for a Warder Therapy Hotline.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 160: Love Geometry
fields.description:
In chapters 49 and 50, the Salidar embassy uses Big Gandalf Magic, Rand forces everyone to Evacuate Caemlyn, Hashtag Bully Lives Matter, Aes Sedai use the Bloody Mary Rule, and our printer is a Romanceable NPC. Enjoy! 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 159: Ofgayle
fields.description:
For ch. 47-48, we talk about Playing Coma, Ebou Dar's fairy tale qualities (and, on that note, Mat's new movie, Untangled), how the Whitecloaks Should All Be Played by the Same Guy, and how spotting Carridin is like seeing Ted Cruz.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 158: Vilnar the Science Guard
fields.description:
For ch. 45-46, we review the Sex and the City franchise (bad), talk about Aram's Bloodthirsty Stage, demand that Robert Jordan elaborate on the Kissing Rituals, and discuss CSI: Saldaea and Slap Tuesday.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 157: If Talmanes Had a Gun
fields.description:
This episode is ostensibly about ch. 43-44, but at one point Sally lists every Disney Channel Original Movie that she can remember. Also discussed: Skateboarding Pervert, the Complexity of Women, Emily's Dickensian Upbringing, and Sexy Rat.

Lindsay Ellis Video. 

Sexy Rat.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 156: Made of Water Bottles
fields.description:
In chapters 41-42, Min spends a whole chapter acting like a 10th grader, Rand doesn't understand why The Farm sounds so ominous, and Mazrim Taim is humiliated when his mortal enemy puts some Girl Scout badges on him. Bonus topic: Deprogramming the Asha'man.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 155: That Lying Skank, Laritha
fields.description:
Chs. 38-40 teach us some valuable lessons about women's agency and some not-so-valuable lessons about how all women are liars and idiots. Thanks, RJ. Other talking points: Mat's Dump Was Charisma, Egg's Dozen, and Totally Benign Knife-Sharpening.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 154: Egg! Egg! Egg! Egg!
fields.description:
As the tax man cometh, so do ch. 36-37. We discuss the classist implications of the Perfect Servant Trope, Egwene's Zero-to-Sixty Leadership Competence versus Rand's Parabola of Competence to Insanity, and we ask once again: Why doesn't Elayne just GO to Andor?

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 153: Astral Projection of a Horse
fields.description:
So these ones are bad. Chapters 34-35 are just real stinkers. We'll talk about why -- hint: the rampant transphobia and misogyny -- but luckily we'll also talk about some Jesus Lore and cap the episode with every horse name we can remember. 

CW: discussions of transphobia, Aran'gar
 
Transcript

fields.title: Episode 152: Spiritually in a McDonald's
fields.description:
There's a lot going on in ch. 31-33. We visit the Questioner Cathedral, explain why you Can't Drown a Mermaid, learn the Secret to the Female Orgasm (it's a car crash), sell Mat an On-Fire Iron Flute, and Explore the Inherent Eroticism of Gazing at One's Sword. You're welcome?

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 151: Dominating Friends and Manipulating People
fields.description:
Unsurprisingly, ch. 29-30, set in Salidar, absolutely suck. We discuss Freud's Wet Dream (Thom and Elayne), Nynaeve Being a gOoD LiTtLe wOmAn, Equal Opportunity Sluts, and we demand to know: Where Are the Vineyards?

TW: Aran'gar

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 150: The Worst Man You Know
fields.description:
In our coverage of ch. 28, we remind Rand and his Goldfish Brain about Diplomacy (Get Some). We also commission a Lews Therin Motivational Poster and remind you: Don't Be Anthony.

CW: This episode discusses the sexual assault that happens in this chapter.
 
Transcript

fields.title: Episode 149: Pope Shark
fields.description:
Who or what is Pope Shark, and what does it have to do with Wheel of Time? Well, nothing. But for ch. 26-27, we also talk about Bashere's Tik Tok Account, Rand's Analysis Paralysis, Spotting Mormons in the Wild, and Magic Goosebumps (Tingling Saidar Senses).

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 148: Mostly Ferris Wheel Stuff
fields.description:
Have you ever wondered if there's any WoT content on Pornhub? Don't worry, Sally will look it up. Talking points for ch. 24-25 include: Aiel Copycat Murderers, Eggy Phantom,  Gawyn's Traveling Frat House, and Charming White Man (Derogatory).

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 147: "The Swiss Army Knife of Buttholes"
fields.description:
During ch. 22-23, Emily has no idea what's going on (as usual). But seriously, where's all this going? Where's the pay-off to this set-up? We need Poirot Cauthon on the case. At least we have Olver's rock resume to keep us going.

Transcript

fields.title: The Lost Tapes: Episode 146
fields.description:
Hi, everyone! This isn't a full-length episode, and the info covered here can also be found on our Instagram. This is mostly meant for anyone who might be listening after the release date and doesn't want to scroll through social media to get the deets. Thanks for being cool!

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 145: Fanny Pack of Clif Bars
fields.description:
In ch. 17-18, we're asking hard questions, like: What if Berelain was a mentor to Egg? What if Rand used creative problem-solving? Where does Juilin put the thieves he catches? And which fruit WAS it, actually, in the Garden of Eden?

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 144: Stopcough Herb
fields.description:
Welcome to 2021! We think Halwin Norry should be Queen of Andor. Other controversial topics from ch. 15-16 include Pillows of Fiber, Gawyn's Sim Sex Dreams, Egg-ucation, and how Salidar is just Plot Purgatory.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 143: Traveling Corn on the Cob Salesman
fields.description:
Our entire podcast might be one big foible, but at least we're not Aes Sedai dropouts. For ch. 13-14, we discuss Kool-Aid Man Tarna Feir, Nynaeve's Foreshadowing Bucket, and everything wrong with Gawyn's Toxic Dream Fantasy (it's a lot).

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 142: Enchanted by the Pringles
fields.description:
This episode (ch. 11-12) is short only because we had to delete our Top Five Sexiest Anime Men discussion. Uncut are our talks about Brandy on the Binky, Mazrim Taim's Second Location, CSI: Caemlyn, the Boys-Throwing-Rocks Instinct, and Theodrin, Queen of Staying in Her Lane.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 141: Sexy Gholam
fields.description:
This episode, covering ch. 9-10, includes some of our hottest takes: Idris Elba should be in a "Hatchet" movie. Unlike Pedron Niall, at least Rand has a to-do list. Everyone is bad at Minecraft. And Bashere is a master of emotional curb-stomping.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 140: Sprinkle in Some Torture Porn
fields.description:
Oh, Lord of Chaos, asking the big questions, like, "Is torture still bad even when the people getting tortured are annoying?" Yes, actually! For ch. 7-8, we discuss Fantasy Ambien, Demandred's Evil Laugh, Editorial Conflict of Interest, and Salidar Video Game Glitching.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 139: Hypothetical Game of Thrones Writers Trolley Problem
fields.description:
Ch. 5-6 are good and bad. Bad because of the Human Circus, the Short Bastard Man, and the Whitest Woman to Ever White. Good because of the Dark One's Candy Mountain and Mat's OT4. Are themes just for eighth graders and wimps? You be the judge.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 138: Recreational Horse Stunts
fields.description:
For chapters 3-4, we talk about Cricket Player Douchebaggery, Weaponizing Toxic Masculinity (and Toxic Femininity!), Mazrim Taim's School for Deranged War Criminals, and how Famine Has Control of Boston. Now with better audio quality!

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 137: 9-1-1 Bishop
fields.description:
We're getting sued by Shrek for our coverage of chapters 1 and 2. Discussion points include: Bashere's Erotic Energy, Tybalt the Fartful Dodger, Mazrim Taim Slip 'n' Slide, and a War Crimes-Shaped Cookie Cutter. Uh, sorry?

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 136: The Forsaken Reality TV
fields.description:
Apologies for the low volume as we adjust to a new recording space. We finish the prologue by discussing John Travlota Rand, Alternate Lord of Chaos Titles, D-d-damn Daniel, Bad Decision-Making in the Royal House of Andor, and Rand's Monarchy (But Make It Bigger). 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 135: It's All Bad
fields.description:
Welcome to season six! The title says it all. We get halfway through the prologue of Lord of Chaos, discussing Pop Culture Neo, Who Needs to Be Guillotined, The Dark One Firing Demandred, and Rand's Revolving Door of Women.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 134: Indigenous Peoples' Day Special Episode
fields.description:
We haven't worked up the courage to face Lord of Chaos yet, so we decided to discuss how (and if!) indigenous people are represented in Wheel of Time. We also laugh for, like, ten minutes at the word "moo-nionizing." 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 133: Last Battle Participation Trophy
fields.description:
The heavens have been fired, and we're officially done with book five! And what a chaotic ride it's been. For chapters 55-56, we talk about Moghedien's Opera Glasses, how Nynaeve Has the High Ground, and Rand's School for Boys Who Want to Do Magic.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 132: Men Don't Have Tear Ducts
fields.description:
If you think men have tear ducts, chapters 53-54 will prove you wrong. This episode will also prove that Emily is gay and can't do math, that Lan has reached a new low on the break-up scale (BENEATH Facebook Messenger break-up), and that we're all just following Fast and Furious logic. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 131: Titty Graveyard
fields.description:
We've reached one of the most iconic sequences in the Wheel of Time: when Moiraine stage manages the HELL out of her own "death." For ch. 51 & 52, we also talk about Sexy Zombie Mat, Catching Frish, Don't Skin the Messenger, and Sulin Joining Mat's War Council. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 130: Sisters or Coworkers, No In Between
fields.description:
Ch. 49 and 50 are so, so long. There's no humor to be found in them, but a lot of questions: Should Sherlock Holmes be sexy? Is smuggling a victimless crime? Are the seals actually important? Has Robert Jordan heard of friends? 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 129: Analysis Juice
fields.description:
Robert Jordan is taking leaves in ch. 47 & 48, just like he always does. Other discussion topics include: Egg's Amyrlin Box, Jazz Hands Shimmying, Be Nicer to Mat 2k20, and Galad's Bleached Violence.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 128: Were-Pokemon
fields.description:
This week, we cover ch. 45-46, and Mat goes on Reddit to ask: AITA? Meanwhile, Asmodean can't pronounce the word "friend," Moiraine supervises Special K, the nobility suffer through an unsanitary spear kissing ritual, and Robert Jordan uses his page space unwisely. What else is new?

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 127: Fantasy Jesus Has a Death Wish
fields.description:
We'd like to remind you that we are not the glee club. Other discussion topics for chapters 43-44 include: Signature for Ants, Beefalo, and Mantrum with Lantrum. Plus, for the first time ever, Lan actually acts like a good mentor?  

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 126: The Holy Quadrangle of Fascinating Dildo Things
fields.description:
As the title implies, there's a highly graphic sidebar in this episode about the big blue dildo in HBO's "Watchmen." Whoops! More WoT-centric topics include: Glass-Blowing Inconsistencies, Mat's Transition Lenses, and Miners vs. Minors. Chapters 41 & 42. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 125: The Jon Hamm Bubble
fields.description:
Chapters 39 and 40 are here to teach us all about cults (and whether you're in one)! Discussion topics include: a Tybalt-centric Universe, Masema's 12 Friends Justice System, Alliandre's Resume, and Fergalicious Galaxy Brain.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 124: Pocketfuls of Confetti
fields.description:
Emily "Eyeball" Juchau and Sally "Sadness" Goodger are back after a brief hiatus to talk about ch. 37 and 38. We'll discuss the history of circuses and "freak shows" and the intersections between human cruelty and animal cruelty. If that sounds like a downer, worry not: there's a guy named Philip Ass-ley involved. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 123: The Most Dangerous Game
fields.description:
In chapters 35 and 36, Elayne wrestles with some sticky consent issues, Robert Jordan plays queer-coding dodgeball, Valan Luca is a cult leader, and Birgitte is the only emotionally healthy person in this circus full of bummers. Enjoy! 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 122: Tittelligence
fields.description:
For chapters 33 and 34, we recover from sex igloo mostly by making fun of Elayne. We'll talk about her Sudden Passion for Carpentry, Galad Eating Falafel, the Forsaken's Chair Personalities, and, of course, Emily's Wonky Right Hip. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 121: The Enya Enigma
fields.description:
This episode is so long, just because there is so much misogyny, toxic masculinity, bad writing, and issues of consent in the Sex Igloo chapters (31 and 32). We'll lay it all out for you. But don't worry -- we will also wonder Where Enya Is Now for ten minutes. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 120: Snap, Crackle, Squash
fields.description:
Oh, chapters 29 and 30? You mean the ones where a woman gets dismembered and Rand doesn't know what taxes are? Hard pass. We talk about Immune System Football, Officer Nepotism, Ghost Vampires, and the Bra/Public Execution Scale.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 119: Chekhov's Halo of Greatness
fields.description:
In our coverage of ch. 26-28, we really challenge ourselves: to understand whether Min has an Oedipus complex, to rate Gareth Bryne's misogynistic comments, to name at least six Aes Sedai, and to look into Siuan's floating Gatsby eyes. Good luck.  

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 118: Read Black Authors, Not Wheel of Time
fields.description:
Read Black revolutionary texts: https://tinyurl.com/yabm3ggz
 
Buy from Black-owned bookstores: https://aalbc.com/bookstores/list.php  
 
Support Black Lives Matter: https://blacklivesmatters.carrd.co/# 
 
Transcript

fields.title: Episode 117: Egghienda, an Omelet
fields.description:
Sadly, chapters 24 and 25, though thematically romantic, aren't as sexy as we'd like. Join us as we talk about Egwene's Domesticity Dreams, the Devil Wears Prada Syndrome, Elaida's HGTV Dream Home, and Horny Anime Nosebleeds! 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 116: Dunking on Bono
fields.description:
Our coverage of ch. 22-23 is brought to you by Subaru! We talk about Mat's Dump-truck Ass, Leo's Bear Invulnerability, Bastard Requirements, and, of course, Wheel of Time sex ed: If You Have Sex, You WILL Be Attacked by Trollocs, and You WILL Die.  

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 115: Melancholy Culkin
fields.description:
After reading chapters 20 & 21, we have decided to run for governor. Join us as we blaze our campaign trail and talk about Jenga Mountains, Hashtag Vulture Hate, Baby Asmodean, Brandbert, and Normalizing Unsexual Tension. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 114: An Ode to Well-Legged Devin
fields.description:
If we are being honest, the bulk of this episode (ch. 17-19) is a discussion about sexualized fruits. But we made time for a discussion about Valan Luca's Circus of Hiding People, Blaming Rand's Dick on a Cosmic Level, Gaebril/Gerbil, and False "Feminism" Fatigue. TW: We discuss sexual assault in this episode. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 113: We Are Not Condoning the Assassination of the Archduke Franz Ferdinand
fields.description:
You might think the title of this episode says it all about chapters 15 & 16, but there's so much more to the story: HGTV Amyrlin Office, Man Talk, and Trom: Legend. We go zero to a hundred, just like Elayne about Galad and World War I. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 112: Well-Turned Leggies
fields.description:
Our coverage of chapters 13 & 14 is weirdly leg-centric, but that's just because Valan Luca is here now. Conversation topics include: Celebrity Man Legs, Baba Yaga House With Chris's Legs, Jon Hamm Island, and the Sharan Spider Infestation.  

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 111: Lugard, A Great Place to Hide a Body
fields.description:
For chapters 11 & 12, we visit (and try to pronounce) Lugard, demand Reasonably Sized Text, salute the Once and Future Pope, and discuss the Whitecloak Witch Capture Quota. TW: We talk about sexual assault in this episode.  

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 110: CSI: Wheelworld
fields.description:
Welcome to Whitecloak Country, y'all! In chapters 8, 9, & 10, Nynaeve does a Dust Storm Whoopsie, Elayne has a terminal case of Desire Within the Patriarchy, Juilin Trains the Police, and we meet someone whose name is definitely pronounced Rhonda.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 109: Minions, When Slaughtered
fields.description:
For chapters 6 & 7, we've captured the Day 17 (at the time of recording) mood: the Live Action Despicable Me Remake. There's also Record-Breaking Boner Talk, Rand's Shawshank Redemption, Illegal Dream Homework, and the Dirty Emond's Field Watering Hole.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 108: Pain Box
fields.description:
It's not the pandemic that's got us down; it's all the misogyny in chapters 4 & 5. We cope with Ogier Minecraft Vision, the Sex Tent, Perma-Gai'shain, Baylee Domon, and the harsh reality that Robert Jordan just didn't know about sports bras. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 107: Elite Forsaken Kill Squad
fields.description:
It may feel like the world is screeching to a halt, but EHR is still recording! For chapters 2 and 3, we talk about Team Chuck Tingle, Sweaty Chic, The Peak of A-Hole, and Mat's Juicy Couture Shorts. Wash your hands and stay horny for Mat, everyone!  

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 106: Cow Heaven
fields.description:
Chapter one of The Fires of Heaven is truly rancid. We're forced to discuss Randerdale, the Death Yo-Yo, Mat's Tax Evasion, OK Boomer Energy, and the Perfect MILF (not Morgase, sadly). Also: alternate Fires of Heaven titles. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 105: Cold, Sexy Eyeballs
fields.description:
The Fires of Heaven, huh? Sure are fiery, huh? Welcome to season five! We talk about the title, the cover, and the prologue. Discussion topics include: World's Worst Dad, Horny for Land, Bavram Dashere, Find My Galad (it's an app), and Lesbian Boot Camp.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 104: I Wish You Had Not Done This
fields.description:
The Shadow Rising is OVER, and not a second too soon. Talking points for these last two chapters include: Bible.wiki, Hbo Presents: Popes, Museum Rhetoric, Lanfear's Gollum Tits, Chekhov's Kal, and Rand's Baby Bjorn.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 103: Yeet the Sad Bracelets
fields.description:
The Two Rivers tradition of yeeting magical objects continues in chapters 54 and 55. Also making appearances: Deus Ex Bayle Domon, Shooting to Still, Justice's Carriage, and how Horribly Unsexy Murder is. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 102: The Slayer Mythos
fields.description:
For episodes 53 and 56, we celebrate Robert Jordan's Vision of the Future: a book without Perrin. We talk about Royal Gossip Girl, the Galad Worthiness Test, Fixing Berelain, and how Perrin spits in the face of Video Game Logic. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 101: EARN THE EGG
fields.description:
