Finally, over 100 episodes in, we've learned that maybe we should just listen to our listeners. For chapters 51 and 52, we rant about Hard Lines and the Romeo Nazi and discuss the David Beckham Sleeping Fetish and the Only Thing That Can Kill Sally.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 100: Badonkahonkamungos
fields.description:
Can you believe you've listened to 100 episodes of this buffoonery? We can't! To celebrate, we asked our friends and listeners to talk about Wheel of Time, because they're funnier than us anyway. Discussion topics: Implausible Nynaeve AU, G-Brothers, Relephant, Cat Cooties Kazoo, and Ran or Land?

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 99: Air Criminal
fields.description:
Arguably the best part of this episode is the listener-submitted sign-off. (Thanks, Gavin!) That said, our coverage of ch. 48-50 does bring up discussion topics like the Montage-ologue, PhDs in Swords, Roofmistress Throw-Down, and Hozier's WoT Rewrite. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 98: ROXANNE!
fields.description:
For chapters 46-47, we couldn't talk about the Breaking of the White Tower without reviewing the Papal Schism, right? And hey, how come so many ding-dang buildings are breaking? Also up for discussion: U2 Stockholm Syndrome, Texan Seanchan, the Paradox of Queering, Logain's Later Days, and Man Batteries.  

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 97: Loial's Lethal Eyebrows
fields.description:
In another trio of Perrin chapters (43-45), we pull ourselves together long enough to talk about Ladder-Looking Lads, Egg Mom, Himbo Solidarity, Big Bard Energy, and Horse Therapy. We also cast One Direction for, what, the ninth time?

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 96: Purr-gatory
fields.description: In this episode, which does technically cover the content of chapters 40-42, the unstoppable force of "Cats" met the immovable object of our hatred of Perrin. So while we barely talked about Wheel of Time, we do feel better, and that's what matters. Happy New Year.

fields.title: Episode 95: Everybody Needs a Water Criminal
fields.description:
Chapters 38 and 39 are holding us hostage. The demands for our safe return? Delete Carridin and Liandrin's Evil Girl Band. Tell us why Juilin is in the plot. Don't do a violence. And please, for the love of God, let all witchcraft trials be decided by sharks.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 94: ARE YOU NOT HORNY?!
fields.description:
To make up for our time off, here's an extra-long episode, half of which is about the books we read on vacation. The other half tackles topics like Flip-Floppiest Boy, Bullsh*t Bobby, Tall Stink Man, Himbo Gawyn, and Thom vs. the TSA. Chapters 36 and 37.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 93: RSVP to the Breaking of the Aiel
fields.description:
For chapters 34 and 35, we discuss the Tarantino Return from Rhuidean, Yeet Punctuation, Rand's Mermaid Arms, Mat's Duolingo Owl Energy, and, of course, we figure out yet again how to fix Wheel of Time. (Hint: Weekend at Bernie's.) 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 92: Lord Luc's Lifehacks
fields.description:
For some reason we are discussing THREE Perrin chapters, which is just too much (31, 32, and 33). Suggested talking points: Optical Illusion Height, Ghost Perrin, Charles Dickens Propaganda, Casting Wil al'Seen, and Hairy Kit-Kats. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 91: Anyway, That Was Tubthumping
fields.description:
This episode is a a bit short, just like the lives of Perrin's three dozen family members. For chapters 29 and 30, we talk about Cenn Buoy, Nynaeve's Greek Goddess Birth, the Toxic Monogamy Godzilla, and Litigation Phobia.  

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 90: Hat Cauthon
fields.description:
In our efforts to ignore the actual events of chapters 27 and 28, we discussed Rambo Tactics, Diablo Ex Machina, Rows and Cravens, Gaul's (Correct) Priorities, and whether there's a Florida equivalent in Wheel of Time.  

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 89: Covert Sexism Juice
fields.description:
This one's academic, y'all. To talk about chapters 25 and 26, Sally's taking us deep into cosmogony, the Universal Dad, and the power of perspective. And Emily's reminding us that women are EVIL and feminism is BAD. Are you taking NOTES? 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 88: Hammerhead-urabi's Code
fields.description:
After some heavy editing, our Long Episode about chapters 23 and 24 is a reasonable length, and it's here to educate you about Debbie, the Archetypal Wife, Sniper No Sniping, Mat's Hierarchy of Needs, and Shark Law. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 87: That's WHY He's the Dragon
fields.description:
In this episode, we discuss chapters 21 and 22. Sort of. Mostly, we ask a lot of questions, like: What does vibe check mean? Would Teen Narc make a good graphic novel? What does the "z" in "zaddy" stand for? And, hey, Sally? What's Boy Design? 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 86: Gibbermast
fields.description:
Speaking of nipple chafing, you can learn a lot about a lot of things in our coverage of chapters 18, 19, and 20! You'll learn about Curly Boys, Metaphorical Basements, when the wind was invented, and how boats float! Emily also mispronounces every boat term that there is! 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 85: Public Marriage Proposal Gun
fields.description:
Come for the perfect casting of Loial, stay for the erotic Maze Runner fantasies. In our coverage of chapters 16 and 17, Sally teaches us all about toxic monogamy, and Emily advocates for an alternate timeline where Thom goes to Rhuidean. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 84: Run, Serena Williams of Battles
fields.description:
Three chapters in one episode! For chapters 13, 14, and 15, we argue on behalf of Equal Opportunity Sweat Tents, discuss Perrin and Faile's celebrity couple name (Ferret?), Mat's Fate Leash, and sign off with a Train Fainter.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 83: Falafel Tinder
fields.description:
Do you believe that falafel is the most dangerous game? Do you think they should probably just CGI Galad? And that Robert Jordan might be a Highlander? Did you get your FLU SHOT? This episode, where we cover chapters 11 and 12, might be for you.  

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 82: Elayne? Total Wifey
fields.description:
Thanks to Lanfear's reappearance, our coverage of chapters 9 and 10 takes us back to EHR sex ed. Welcome! We talk about Wandering Wombs, Super Sperm, Chastity and Chivalry, plus Detective Lan and The Dark One's Rubric.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 81: Jermathan Steelrod
fields.description:
Welcome to EHR After Dark ... and get ready for the Bad Porn Energy that is explored at LENGTH in chapters 7 and 8. We're Hetrified by Elayne's "Eye" Contact, delighted by Les-Egg, and grateful for Sex Ed with Sally. Hey, does juice have texture?

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 80: Jugs and Meat
fields.description:
What do Nihilist D&D Characters, Responsible Horniness, The Road Less Traveled, and Lan's Rorschach Test of Silk all have in common? Absolutely nothing.

This week's chapters: chapters 5 & 6 in the Shadow Rising. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 79: Post-Apocalyptic Knitwear
fields.description:
This episode has everything: serious questions, like, is Sir Ian McKellen whimsical? Less serious questions, like, is Perrin's nose a mood ring? There's literary analysis on the relative physicality of characters. Also: Perrin's hot??

This week's chapters: Chapters 3 & 4 in The Shadow Rising. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 78: Emily Forgets the Word "Video"
fields.description:
In this long episode (sorry), we're getting back to our roots! Sally has literary theory like intrusive fantasy and pathetic fallacy to discuss! Emily talks about the sequels to Gary Paulsen's "Hatchet" in excruciating detail! EHR's GREATEST HITS!

This week's chapters: Chapter 2 in The Shadow Rising. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 77: This is Sad Bornhald
fields.description:
Welcome to chapter one of The Shadow Rising! We're inventing Lesbian Chess, giving you an EHR make-up tutorial, and making sure you know Gawyn has a journal, NOT a diary. Remember: Don't do war crimes!

This week's chapters: Chapter 1 in The Shadow Rising 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 76: Is He Snek?
fields.description:
At some point in this episode, you'll hear a BEEP, and that is Emily derailing the podcast to eat her pizza. You'll also hear our Alt Shadow Rising Titles, our great Baz Luhrmann Circus Idea, and the return of Sally Googles Things.

Transcript

fields.title: EHR Extra: Teen Narc
fields.description:
As we prep for The Shadow Rising, you asked for advice and we ... have it? We tell to Dominate the World with Alexander the Great's Methods, Wear a Plague Doctor Mask to Work, Get Yourself a Shark Wife, and Gaslight Your Coworkers.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 75: H.A.G.S.
fields.description:
In our extra-long season finale, we're talking about the rotating Two Rivers Brain Cells, Egwene's Smack-O, Ishamael's Flair for the Dramatic, and the Perfect Opportunity for a Freeze Frame. KABOOM.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 74: Lavril Avigne
fields.description:
We've finally found a villain for our fantasy heist crew! Not to mention all our VERY on-topic lines of discussion, like Faile's Insta, the Adopted Hedgehog, Fantasy Urgent Care, and All the Drug Dealers We Know. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 73: Patagonia Jerkin
fields.description:
It's a rambly episode as we discuss ideal casting for the WoT TV series (Ocean's Forsaken, people! The Keanussaince!), Emo Innkeepers, Clockin' Ott, and Balefire Cheat Code. Plus our general confusion over jerkins vs. vests. S.O.S.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 72: Bee Hugs
fields.description:
Hey, most of EHR is NSFW but this episode is particularly and horrifically NSFW in the first two minutes. We're talking about our Banned Phrases, Top Sexy Mat Moments, Trading Spaces, Vomit Updates, and the Police Brutality State that is Tear.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 71: Why Boom Small?
fields.description:
This week we're back in Caemlyn, which means we're seeing some familiar faces! Join us as we talk about Basel Gill's Cat Cafe, Rand's Murder Gap Year, Tallanvor the Killjoy, and the triumphant Return of xBrian.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 70: The Stink Quarter
fields.description:
We're back, and we've got some pretty challenging ideas to discuss. Like Faile and Perrin's Straight Pride. Oh, and there's Bringing an Axe to Applebee's, Empathy Boners, and hey . . . where IS Germany?  

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 69: Throat Latch
fields.description:
Sixty-NINE! In honor of the sex number, we're ranking Shrek movies (obviously), Googling horse anatomy, making fun of Lan's Chastity Ring, and talking about the Aiel's Super Soldier Serum Lizard Protein Shakes.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 68: Brad Pitt Didn't Die For This
fields.description:
It's a very educational episode! We talk about King Charles' Glass Butt, Mirror Espionage, and, as always, end up at EHR Sex Ed. We also improve the Iliad by making Everyone Orlando Bloom.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 67: Feline Rear Window
fields.description:
We get into some challenging lines of discussion in this one, including Tall Babies, the Choice to Be a Walking Sex Dream (it's a pun), and Paul Bettany's butt. We also ask the question: can cats spell "murder"?

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 66: Pervert of a Took
fields.description:
We're one digit away from 666, but this is still a cursed episode, re: the image of Gandalf in a sexy robe. Also, we pay homage to Danny DeVito, try to remember the stroke acronym F.A.S.T., and witness the Return of Jeremy. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 65: Fresca Heart
fields.description:
Put on your slutty pop music sequence and get ready for a vocab lesson! While Mat goes on a gambling binge through the Fantasy Vatican, we talk about his Odysseus tendencies, his impossible horizon of expectations, and . . . pole-vaulting. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 64: Watch What Happens Live with Mat Cauthon
fields.description:
Hello! It's our very first episode recorded with Adobe Audition! We're using it to talk about Sally's Hand Limbo, Mat's Warfare-Riddled Brain, the Gender Police, and Mat's Love of Dance. Be warned -- we dunk on a few well-established fantasy authors in this one.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 63: Smash Egg?
fields.description:
Discussion topics this week include Feet Al'Thor, the Useless Murder List, Equal Opportunity Perverts, and the ultimate question: what in the hell is Lanfear doing in the White Tower, and why won't she leave?  

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 62: One and a Half Idiots
fields.description:
In which Emily struggles to think of a single attractive man (spoiler: it's Thor), Sally promotes her mom's podcast, and we vow to never use the word "randy" again, especially if it's adjacent to Rand Al'Thor.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 61 Q&A: The Adventures of Fish-Pig
fields.description:
Thanks for the great questions, folks! In this Q&A we spoil Game of Thrones' first season, give you the music recommendations list of the century, and talk about Robot Feelings, Shark Trollocs, and Emily's Offensive Crocodile Hunter Accent.  

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 60: Schrodinger's Dark One
fields.description:
Guess who DEFINITELY remembered our own theme song? And guess who spent forty-five minutes talking about Magic Hazing, Lumberjack Energy, the Annual Hatred of Women Quota, and Emily's Best Retweet (You'll Know)? US.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 59: Fast & Furious Go Juice
fields.description:
A moment of silence because this series is FINALLY BEGINNING. This week we're talking about the Texas Literacy Test, Dungeon Aesthetics, Dildo Wands, Facial Bullying, and Mat's Magpie Tendencies.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 58: Butterfingers
fields.description:
This week's conversation topics include: Alexa For Emily's Grandparents, the TV Show "Monk" (But Make It Gay), Dream Therapy, Hotness Total, and Galad Damodred Has Never Had A Real Job In His Life.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 57: Butt Owie
fields.description:
While we talk about Siuan's Big Bad Mistake, we somehow end up in 16th century France. Other topics include: Hurr Durr Sexy Knife Boy, CrossFit Couple, Charlemagne's Acid Trip, and Magic Hall Passes. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 56: Like a Dip
fields.description:
We get real deep in this one. Join us as we talk about Dumpster Fires, Robert Jordan's Romantic Attraction to Lan, Trigger-Happy Women, and Artur Hawkwing's Carrier Pigeon: Valiant.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 55: Jeremy the Whitecloak
fields.description:
The heist just keeps getting bigger. This week we're talking about Perrinland, Jar Jar Banksy, the Pied Piper of Weddings, the EGOT of Arson, and Two and a Half Larries. It's crazy, y'all.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 54: Asmodean, Play Despacito
fields.description:
In this episode we discuss alternate titles for the Dragon Reborn, Rand pulls a Gone Girl, Perrin goes Elizabethan, and Masema drinks the kool-aid. Can't we all just get along? Seriously, Perrin and Moiraine: JUST GET ALONG.  

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 53: Gaul Eats a Lizard
fields.description:
Gaul might not even be a character in the series yet, but he's present in OUR HEARTS. We're also talking about Whaleworld, Henry the Ain't, Perrin's MeUndies, and SHAKIRA SHAKIRA.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 52: Doctor Opera Closet
fields.description:
We're kicking off season three in style -- unlike the characters on the cover of The Dragon Reborn. We're talking about the Gawyn Redaction Contract, Rejected Mortal Kombat Characters, the Asshole Convention of Amadicia, and Rand's best friends, Mark and Percy.

Transcript

fields.title: EHR Extra: The Height Over Horniness Chart
fields.description:
We might be between seasons, but we're still horny for Gaul! This week we're looking at our brand-new Wheel of Time Companion (thanks, Mitchell!) to discuss Big Wolf Energy, Lini's Terrible Advice, The Three Rivers, and Literally Everyone's Height.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 51: The Kazoo of Valere
fields.description:
The Great Hunt is finally over! In our season finale we talk about Rand's Poor Time Management, Tall Soldiers (Our Weakness), Stabbing Erogenous Zones, Mat's Alter Ego: Johnny Appleseed, and Lanfear's Top Three Iconic Entrances. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 50: The Grave is No Bar to My Yeet
fields.description:
Episode 50, what the heck?! We've been doing this a whole YEAR? We celebrate by talking about Meta Prophecy, Egwene's Evil Twin, Knife Boy, and Emily's Personal Journey through Wheel of Time. Remember, kids: Rand is NOT Judge Judy.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 49: Socks with Sandals
fields.description:
Welcome to the first episode of 2019! It's pretty much a disaster. We talk about Casting Valan Luca, Frat Boy Criteria, The Power and Non-Power of Words, and the Problem with Adrenaline-Based Magic. Also: there's a lot of singing. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 48: Everybody Hates Dillon
fields.description:
We're coming at you DEAD from our couch! Join us in our post-holidays depression as we mispronounce damane and also "palanquin," talk about soft power vs. hard power, and discuss the timing of trauma in fantasy. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 47: A Very Merry Supernatural Christmas
fields.description:
Happy holidays, from our family to yours! Here's an extra-special, extra-long episode where we take a break from WoT with guest Brie Olds. Instead of Wheel of Time, there's Eric Kripke's Steady Hand, Castiel on Trial, Good Brothers and Bad Brothers, and the Real Evil: Sam's Bangs. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 46: As the Raven Crows
fields.description:
This is it. Our horniest episode. We make some important decisions and inappropriate rankings. Also: Alternate titles for The Great Hunt, Universal Truths, Les-beans, and How to Lose a Guy in the Ways.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 45: Multi-Universe Hairdryer
fields.description:
Hey, guys, we read like a million chapters this week. Seriously, so many. Aren't you proud of us? We talked about a Jimmy Buffett Monastery, hit TV show Shienar's Got Talent, and a Glitch in the Portal Stone. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 44: BAR-thanes
fields.description:
Discussion topics this week include My Mind Fire: The Band, Fantasy Hair Cuts, Knife Boy and Lava Girl, The REAL Kingkiller, and Chumbawamba-phobia.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 43: Deus Ex Ingtar
fields.description:
In which we struggle to pronounce Barthanes' name, long for the Betsy Ross/Ross Betsy timeline that never was, and make way too many comparisons to Supernatural. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 42: Urien on Sand
fields.description:
Hey, we got mics! We get a little sappy thanking you for your support, but we're just so excited! Please forgive all audio issues -- Emily is relearning how to record and edit with this fancy new technology. Tune in for Whitecloak Resumes, the Gay Energy in the Atmosphere, and the Nightgown Pervert.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 41: xoxo Gossip Girl
fields.description:
This episode sparked a lot of ideas for the Wheel of Time TV adaptation, including casting Thom Merrilin as Taika Watiti, Rhuarc looking into the camera like he's in the Office, and a really great flashback to that time no one would speak to Mat except his mother. Take note, Amazon.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 40: Very Tight Trope Breeches
fields.description:
This episode was over an hour long until Emily edited out twenty minutes of us arguing over which characters Galad could have sexual tension with. That's pretty much all you need to know.  

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 39: Double-Sided Sword
fields.description:
Sorry for the long episode, but we just couldn't help talking about the sex and power dynamics of the Warder bond for 25 minutes. We also complained about the Heterosexual Lack of Chemistry Default and took a long look at all the fear archetypes in Nynaeve's Magic Hazing Ritual.   

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 38: An Entire Ham
fields.description:
The chapters we read this week were full of Lord of the Rings references, so you KNOW we had a long talk about Magic Artifacts of Doom and Aragorn's sex appeal. We also discussed Drunk Scrabble, Walk-Up Music, and Mat's Polyamorous War Cabinet.  

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 37: Moon Blood
fields.description:
There's a lot of chaotic sexual energy in this episode, and for that at least one of us apologizes. We talk about the Sex Shirt, Daenerys and her Animal Sidekick, and that one unfortunate instance where Gawyn Was Right.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 36: Trope Maze
fields.description:
This episode we're talking about the dreaded literary embodiment of hentai herself, Lanfear. We explain in detail why we hate her, but we also have some non-hentai conversations about Magic Trees, the Talent Cycle, and that TV adaptation that's in the works. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episdoe 35: Protect Your Mind Vault
fields.description:
Hey, this week we're going to alternate dimensions and talking to wolves! We're also spending a great deal of time questioning whether Rand is really Leader Material or Just Tall. (Hint: We think he's just tall and has fancy clothes. He's running a long con.) Thanks for waiting!

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 34: Vanilla in the Streets
fields.description:
All you really need to know headed into this episode is that we really, really, REALLY don't like the term "deflowered."

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 33: Smell Like Bullets
fields.description:
It's a tired and giggly episode of EHR! We're talking about how Lan gives terrible advice, how Hurin should be spending time on his post-grad, and how Uno deserves true love, probably with someone brave and manly. And hilarious. And -- okay, it's Gaul. We've already planned the wedding.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 32: Cool It Down, Couladin
fields.description:
This week we're talking about a very important chapter: the one where the Chosen One finds out he's been Chosen. For once, we feel very bad for Rand. We discuss the narrative, symbolic, mythic, psychological, cosmic significance of this moment. And, of course, we argue that it would be even better if Perrin dabbled in pagan witchcraft. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 31: My Goblin Jesus
fields.description:
This episode, in which we primarily discuss dark prophecies, question Padan Fain's reasoning, and collectively gag over The Great Hunt's weird penchant for graphic violence, we introduce two new characters to our Updated, Revised, and All-Around Better Version of WoT: Larry the Good Trolloc and Ilyeno. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 30: Bodcast: Ninety Push-Ups
fields.description:
In which Rand would totally be a Soul Cycle cult leader, Elaida is Donald Trump, Moiraine's ego is an unstoppable force, Robert Jordan uses RateMyAesSedai dot com, and we humbly suggest that you Do Not Do A War Crime. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 29: Jerkins DON'T Have Sleeves!
fields.description:
We're joined by professional costumer and Yu-Gi-Oh! enthusiast Sarah McClintock to talk about clothes, fantasy, and denim on denim. She helps answer questions like: Why is Robert Jordan obsessed with butts and breeches? Why is the boob situation in Tel'aran'rhiod so important? What happens when you dress a farm boy like a fancy lord and give him responsibility?

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 28: Janet McBible
fields.description:
Please excuse the background hum of AC in this week's episode -- it's 95 degrees in Utah! And a balmy 70 in Fal Dara when the Amyrlin Seat arrives. We talk about Tigger: Rap God, Alien v. Sexual Predator, a Flannel of Lesbians, and get this: we finally consult the pronunciation guide. 

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 27: Wagonpool to Satan
fields.description:
Hey, hey, we're kicking off season two -- and The Great Hunt -- with a ten-minute intro about our homelessness and other misfortunes. Then we talk about Acne and Assholery, Drunk Uncles and Fish Metaphors, and new game show Are You Taller Than a Cello?

Transcript

fields.title: EHR Extra: The Sagittarius-est To Ever Sagittarii
fields.description:
With Sally out of town, this week Emily is joined by guest co-host Cambria Hobbs, our Wheel of Time progenitor and resident astrology expert. We tackle topics like Rand's so-called sex appeal, Gawyn's Gemini-ness, and Robert Jordan's whole anti-birthday thing.

Transcript

fields.title: Q&A Episode: Wot?!
fields.description:
You have questions, and we have answers, on every topic imaginable, from Emily's less-than-stellar academic career to books as murder weapons to Jude Law's true place in the Wheel of Time-verse. Thanks for the questions!​

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 26: BIG BATTLE LADY
fields.description:
Hey there, welcome to our season finale! It's longer and crazier than usual as we wrap up the Eye of the World - discussion topics include Chop-Chop Guy, the Frequency of Cliffs, everyone's Signature Drinks, and Sally's bold argument in favor of Mat's sociopathy.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 25: Jude Law
fields.description:
This is not actually episode 24 as Sally claims it is, but episode 25 where we discuss such important things as the curse of Laura Ingalls Wilder, Just Pure Magic™, what it means to DTR in the Mad Max desert, and Wheel of Time’s most important character: Jude Law.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 24: Perrin ... Took a Different Class
fields.description:
Like Lan's entire country of origin, the entire twenty-minute intro of this episode was deleted. It's fine. This episode is weird enough without it. We talk about Chumbawamb​a: Portal Guardians, our gay uncle Agelmar, and the academic AU.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 23: Magic Space Hell
fields.description:
​In this episode we talk about our heroes' journey through the Ways, but more importantly, we also discuss Mentor Resumes, Edgelord Loial, the Best Shark Attack, Village Idiots, the Shared Kirby Air Ride Consciousness, and Egg Head.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 22: Hand al'Thor
fields.description:
​This episode got a little out of . . . hand. Ha ha! Just a little hand joke for you, about ten books too early for puns like these. But seriously, we should have been talking about the Ways, and instead we complained about this book's weird plot. So it goes.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 21: xBrian
fields.description:
​This is the episode where we Fix Wheel of Time. Of course Rand is in a coma, Mat is illiterate, and everything is gayer, but we also devote about four hundred percent more screen time to the most underrated character in the series: Lamgwin's cat.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 20: That is NOT Dope
fields.description:
We've now recorded twenty episodes of this podcast, which is crazy. Fittingly, we meet about twenty more main characters in this section, most of whom we hate. At least Galad is there!​

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 19: Where Did the Water Go?
fields.description:
We spent the last ten minutes of this episode Googling that whole Luc/Isam thing that Robert Jordan never really explained. Other discussion topics this week include Galad Appreciation, Thom IS The Entree, and Sally Puts Emily On Blast.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 18: From the Chin Down
fields.description:
The boys are off the road and straight into Basel Gill's downtown hotel for wayward and semi-demonically-possessed teens. We talk about arbitrary political decisions, Thom's loan sharks, and how Loial is the world's most precious and perfect boy.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 17: It's Better Than Nothing
fields.description:
WELCOME TO SAD KITCHEN. WE'RE ALL SAD HERE.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 16: What Are They, Mormons?
fields.description:
​We're on the HIIIIGHWAAAY TO HELL. Or Caemlyn, or whatever. This week we're joining Rand and Mat as they spread the gleeman's gospel with a bunch of farmers and inn patrons. There's cow whispering. There's deus ex machina. Most of all, there's the power of friendship.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 15: Sit On Your Laurels
fields.description:
We're finally wrapping up Perrin's points of view, which means we get to ditch the Whitecloaks! At least until book two. Discussion topics include Nynaeve seducing Lan via woodcraft, That's How We Do on Game of Thrones, and Byar as Hannah Arendt's "banality of evil."

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 14: The Butt Flag
fields.description:
Sorry for the long episode, folks. We just got so caught up in our discussion of steddings, statues, Sting, and Galad's tight, tight bod. Downright captivating stuff.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 13: He's Doing Bird Math
fields.description:
We were both sick when we recorded this, so please excuse any coughs, sneezes, or tears that slipped through the editing process. Fittingly, we spent most of this episode talking about mercy-killing. Please, Perrin. The Mucinex isn't working. Use your axe on us.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 12: Tro-la-la-la-locs
fields.description:
We took a week off from our usual recording schedule, but never fear: we've still got that sweet, sweet WoT content for you. Sally listens to and reviews Robert Berry's "A Soundtrack for the Wheel of Time," and Emily refuses to believe that someone actually Did That. Listen along on Spotify.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 11: Alternately, a Real Bear
fields.description:
We're hanging out with the Tinkers this week, and you know what that means: a LONG conversation about sexy dancing. We also wonder about the significance of music in Wheel of Time, weigh in on the passive-aggressive war over Perrin's axe, and worship Egwene: Flirtation Queen. ​

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 10: Petco Clickers Them Into Submission
fields.description:
We're baaaaack! To Perrin and Egwene, that is. Elyas, a wolf-telepathic wild man they just met, has agreed to guide them to Caemlyn, which isn't sketchy at ALL. In this episode we talk mostly about the Tuatha'an, their real-world parallels, and how they deserve better than being a metaphor in Perrin's inner​ conflict about violence.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 9: The Philosopher's Stone? It's Emotional Damage
fields.description:
In our second installment of the "Thom and His Backup Dancers: Rand and Mat" saga, we reach Whitebridge! We talk about ancient architecture, the Illian Timeline, and Thom passing on his Bard-en. Oh, and that dream sequence we completely skipped last week.​

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 8: Ta'veren, Whatever
fields.description:
In this episode we take a minute (or ten) to explain why we hate Rand - though we're also willing to admit he has some good qualities, particularly in this sequence. While Mat goes full Smeagol, we're dealing with pirates, flute-playing, and the epic fantasy tradition of dividing magic and technology. ​

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 7: Do They, Like, Motorize?
fields.description:
We talk more about memes, kinks, and sex toys than we ever will again in this podcast. Hopefully. If you don't think memes, kinks, and sex toys are related to werewolves, think again! So: Is Perrin a furry?​

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 6: Perrin Can Go To The Wolves, LITERALLY
fields.description:
Hey, are you enjoying the dynamics of this here fantasy fellowship? TOO BAD. They're breaking up, just like every boy band ever, and who knows when we'll get the reunion tour? (We do. It'll be in twenty chapters. Buckle in!)

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 5: Give Me More Sentient Fog
fields.description:
​Have you ever visited a cursed city? The world is full of 'em, and so is Wheel of Time. They're pretty interesting, and very dangerous, especially for archetypal tricksters like Mat. If you have a habit of picking up shiny things or keeping secrets from your mentor, you might be in trouble too.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 4: A Family Can Be Your Ex-Babysitter
fields.description:
In Episode 4 we talk about our country bumpkins' first time in a city -- well, a "city." There's a lot to learn in Baerlon, about inns, innkeepers, conquering dream logic, and ~The Future.~ Plus, everyone's favorite babysitter is back!

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 3: Don't Do It In the Murky Pond Water
fields.description:
After a lengthy discussion about "Hatchet" by Gary Paulsen and how it traumatized us, we talk about our heroes' road trip to Baerlon, English long bows, and the importance of taking regular baths. We also realize that Randland is monoreligious, and almost have an aneurysm.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 2: Moonwalk Into Hell
fields.description:
Fantasy Christmas! The perfect occasion for midnight Orc attacks. Wait, we mean Trollocs. Other topics of discussion in this episode include: alternate titles, the WoT adoption process, and Chosen One red flags.

Transcript

fields.title: Episode 1: I Think There's a Tapestry Involved?
fields.description:
Just two hyper-critical English majors talking some pretty big game about The Wheel of Time. We make jokes, ignore the pronunciation guide, make jokes ABOUT the pronunciation guide, and generally hate Rand. Welcome.

Transcript

fields.title: The Wheel of Time: Season 2
fields.description:
It finally happened: the long-teased and much-delayed season 2 of The Wheel of Time hit Amazon Prime! But was worth the wait? Find out as the WOTCast crew unpacks our thoughts on the whole production.
Content Warning: Brief mention of suicide.
 
Hosted and produced by Caleb Wimble (@calebwimble), featuring Dan Kutinsky and Nick Wicks
Support the show and access special bonus content at: patreon.com/wotcast
Send questions, comments, and corrections to: contact@wotcast.net
Website: wotcast.net | Twitter: @WOTCastPodcast | Facebook: @WOTCastPodcast
Find out more about Let Us Build a Tower: A Mythic Bronze Age Adventure in Babel at www.LetUsBuildATower.com. Coming soon to a Kickstarter near you!

fields.title: Bonusode UNLOCKED: The Witcher
fields.description: With the third and perhaps final season of The Witcher now on Netflix, we’re unlocking last year’s Patreon-exclusive bonus episode on all things Witcher-related. If you like what you hear, head to https://www.patreon.com/wotcast and subscribe at our Tar Valon tier for more bonusodes on all sorts of science fiction and fantasy.

fields.title: The Shadow Rising: Chapters 1-10
fields.description:
Aaaaaand we’re back! With season 2 of The Wheel of Time TV show finally on the horizon, we dive into the fan-favorite book of the series, The Shadow Rising. In these action-packed opening chapters, cards attacks, mirrors bite, and the Whitecloaks bear down on a defenseless Two Rivers.
Rand has taken the legendary sword Callandor and conquered the Stone of Tear. But will the weight of responsibility collapse upon him, as nobles scheme and the Forsaken attack his friends relentlessly?
NEXT TIME: Chapters 11-20 of The Shadow Rising

Hosted and produced by Caleb Wimble (@calebwimble), featuring Keeley Frank (@keeley_reads) and Nick Wicks
Support the show and access special bonus content at: patreon.com/wotcast
Send questions, comments, and corrections to: contact@wotcast.net
Website: wotcast.net | Twitter: @WOTCastPodcast | Facebook: @WOTCastPodcast

fields.title: Bonus Episode: The Last of Us, Episodes 4-9 (Preview)
fields.description:
Our The Last of Us discussion continues, this time with Nick and Dan joining Caleb to talk the season 1 finale. And boy have we got some big thoughts on Joel’s big decision!



If the preview piqued your interest, you can hear the full episode over on your private White Tower podcast feed! If you’re not a Patreon subscriber yet, head over to https://www.patreon.com/wotcast to subscribe at the Tar Valon tier or higher and gain access to all our bonus episodes in full.
Content Warnings: Graphic descriptions of body horror, death in childbirth, and violence against children

fields.title: Bonus Episode: The Last of Us, Episodes 1-3 (Preview)
fields.description:
Preview our bonusode discussion of HBO’s The Last of Us premiere episodes with friend of the show Jerry Barney. We dig deep into the history of zombies along with their film and video game legacy. Then we dive into the drama of the hit adaptation and gush about all the feels we were surprised a lonely prepper could make us feel.
After enjoying the preview, you can hear the full episode over on your private White Tower podcast feed! If you’re not a Patreon subscriber yet, head over to https://www.patreon.com/wotcast to subscribe at the Tar Valon tier or higher and gain access to all our bonus episodes in full.
Content Warnings: Graphic descriptions of body horror, stillbirth, suicide
Correction: Reference to Dan O’Bannon should be to John Russo

fields.title: Bonus Episode: The Rings of Power, Episodes 1-2 (Preview)
fields.description:
This bonusode was recorded and uploaded back in September 2022, but due to (Caleb’s) user error was unintentionally deleted from the podcast feed. Here it is again for those who missed it during the brief weeks it was online!
Friend of the show Jerry Barney joins us to talk The Rings of Power, Amazon’s bajillion dollar Lord of the Rings property which launched to widespread interest and attention…before taking some questionable turns down the road to Mordor. In this episode you’ll hear our initial hopeful thoughts after watching the spectacle of the show’s premiere in its first two episodes.
If you like the preview, hear the full episode over on your private White Tower podcast feed! If you’re not a Patreon subscriber yet, head over to https://www.patreon.com/wotcast to subscribe at the Tar Valon tier or higher and gain access to all our bonus episodes in full.

fields.title: The Dragon Reborn: Chapters 51-56
fields.description:
No degree of technical disaster with our recording can stop us from reaching the end of The Dragon Reborn and the original Wheel of Time trilogy!
Perrin enters the Dream World in wolf form to save a trapped Faile in falcon. Mat and a small Aiel army infiltrate the Stone. Moiraine balefires the forsaken Be’lal outta this world, and Rand draws the Sword That Cannot Be Touched to destroy Ba’alzamon once and for all. For real this time, he’s absolutely certain. And Rand’s never been wrong about anything, right?
...Right?
Look forward to more bonus episodes, and then join us after our break to start the much-beloved fourth book of the series, The Shadow Rising.
NEXT TIME: Prologue and Chapters 1-10 of The Shadow Rising

Hosted and produced by Caleb Wimble (@calebwimble), featuring Dan Kutinsky (@panzydan), Keeley Frank (@keeley_reads), and Nick Wicks
Support the show and access special bonus content at: patreon.com/wotcast
Send questions, comments, and corrections to: contact@wotcast.net
Website: wotcast.net | Twitter: @WOTCastPodcast | Facebook: @WOTCastPodcast
Find out more about SOJOURN RPG at www.sojournrpg.net and start playing today!

fields.title: The Dragon Reborn: Chapters 46-50
fields.description:
All our paths lead to Tear, where trap after trap is set and sprung. Mat and Thom rush to save Elayne and co from darkfriend assassins as Elayne and co pursue the Black Ajah and Perrin’s cohort strive to reach Rand before the forsaken Be’lal can use the Dragon Reborn to seize Callandor.
NEXT TIME: Chapters 51-56 of The Dragon Reborn

Hosted and produced by Caleb Wimble (@calebwimble), featuring Dan Kutinsky (@panzydan), Keeley Frank (@keeley_reads), and Nick Wicks
Support the show and access special bonus content at: patreon.com/wotcast
Send questions, comments, and corrections to: contact@wotcast.net
Website: wotcast.net | Twitter: @WOTCastPodcast | Facebook: @WOTCastPodcast
Find out more about SOJOURN RPG at www.sojournrpg.net and start playing today!

fields.title: The Dragon Reborn: Chapters 41-45
fields.description:
Something’s rotten in the state of Illian. Perrin and company arrive in the creepy city and survive soulless attacks to learn there are not one, but two forsaken hunting them here. Moiraine unleashes balefire on Sammael’s darkhounds to escape the wild hunt. Meanwhile Mat plots his way to deliver Elayne’s message to Queen Morgase in Caemlyn.
NEXT TIME: Chapters 46-50 of The Dragon Reborn

Hosted and produced by Caleb Wimble (@calebwimble), featuring Dan Kutinsky (@panzydan), Keeley Frank (@keeley_reads), and Nick Wicks
Support the show and access special bonus content at: patreon.com/wotcast
Send questions, comments, and corrections to: contact@wotcast.net
Website: wotcast.net | Twitter: @WOTCastPodcast | Facebook: @WOTCastPodcast
Find out more about SOJOURN RPG at www.sojournrpg.net and start playing today!

fields.title: The Dragon Reborn: Chapters 36-40
fields.description:
Perrin enters the wolf dream and is guided by Hopper to eavesdrop on secrets of the Forsaken. Rand murders a convoy of merchants in what may or may not be self-defense. Egwene, Elayne, and Nynaeve enter a war-torn land and become entangled with Aiel spearmaidens sent to seek their prophesied messiah. Mat and Thom rescue a disgraced firework-maker from assassins and receive a gift for their troubles.
Content Warning: discussion of sexual violence.
NEXT TIME: Chapters 41-45 of The Dragon Reborn

Hosted and produced by Caleb Wimble (@calebwimble), featuring Dan Kutinsky (@panzydan), Keeley Frank (@keeley_reads), and Nick Wicks
Support the show and access special bonus content at: patreon.com/wotcast
Send questions, comments, and corrections to: contact@wotcast.net
Website: wotcast.net | Twitter: @WOTCastPodcast | Facebook: @WOTCastPodcast
Find out more about SOJOURN RPG at www.sojournrpg.net and start playing today!

fields.title: The Dragon Reborn: Chapters 31-35
fields.description:
Mat is reunited with Thom Merrilin and flees Tar Valon with the now-morose old Gleeman. Perrin frees a strange man in a cage at great cost and meets the woman who may be his Min-foretold “Falcon.” 
NEXT TIME: Chapters 36-40 of The Dragon Reborn

Hosted and produced by Caleb Wimble (@calebwimble), featuring Dan Kutinsky (@panzydan), Keeley Frank (@keeley_reads), and Nick Wicks
Support the show and access special bonus content at: patreon.com/wotcast
Send questions, comments, and corrections to: contact@wotcast.net
Website: wotcast.net | Twitter: @WOTCastPodcast | Facebook: @WOTCastPodcast
Find out more about SOJOURN RPG at www.sojournrpg.net and start playing today!

fields.title: The Dragon Reborn: Chapters 26-30
fields.description:
Egwene enters the dream world of Tel’aran’rhiod—say that five times fast—and tracks the Black Ajah to the Stone of Tear, where she, Elayne, and Nynaeve intend to spring the trap set for them. Meanwhile Mat is dispatched to Caemlyn with a message for Elayne’s mother, Queen Morgase. 
NEXT TIME: Chapters 31-35 of The Dragon Reborn

Hosted and produced by Caleb Wimble (@calebwimble), featuring Dan Kutinsky (@panzydan), and Keeley Frank (@keeley_reads)
Support the show and access special bonus content at: patreon.com/wotcast
Send questions, comments, and corrections to: contact@wotcast.net
Website: wotcast.net | Twitter: @WOTCastPodcast | Facebook: @WOTCastPodcast
Find out more about SOJOURN RPG at www.sojournrpg.net and start playing today!

fields.title: The Dragon Reborn: Chapters 16-25
fields.description:
The hunt for darkfriends within the White Tower intensifies as Egwene undergoes her trials to become Accepted and learns a great deal about her potential futures. Listen to find out why Keeley is more hyped to talk about these chapters than any other WoT readings to date!
NEXT TIME: Chapters 26-30 of The Dragon Reborn

Hosted and produced by Caleb Wimble (@calebwimble), featuring Dan Kutinsky (@panzydan), and Keeley Frank (@keeley_reads)
Support the show and access special bonus content at: patreon.com/wotcast
Send questions, comments, and corrections to: contact@wotcast.net
Website: wotcast.net | Twitter: @WOTCastPodcast | Facebook: @WOTCastPodcast
Find out more about SOJOURN RPG at www.sojournrpg.net and start playing today!

fields.title: The Dragon Reborn: Chapters 11-15
fields.description:
This week we get our long-awaited adventures in the White Tower. Egwene, Nynaeve, and Elayne return to an unexpectedly terrible welcome which sees them thrust into the role of Black Ajah hunters—though at least the Amyrlin Seat confers a promotion in the process.
Danger abounds around every corner, with more darkfriends hiding in Tar Valon and a lethal new form of shadowspawn waiting for our would-be hunters with a knife in the dark. Yet Nynaeve seems to be hiding a shadowy plan of her own...
NEXT TIME: Chapters 16-25 of The Dragon Reborn

Hosted and produced by Caleb Wimble (@calebwimble), featuring Dan Kutinsky (@panzydan), and Keeley Frank (@keeley_reads)
Support the show and access special bonus content at: patreon.com/wotcast
Send questions, comments, and corrections to: contact@wotcast.net
Website: wotcast.net | Twitter: @WOTCastPodcast | Facebook: @WOTCastPodcast
Find out more about SOJOURN RPG at www.sojournrpg.net and start playing today!

fields.title: The Dragon Reborn: Prologue and Chapters 1-10
fields.description:
We’re back for a brand new season of booklearnin’ with The Dragon Reborn!
Children of the Light and shadowspawn alike plot against our newly proclaimed Dragon. Perrin, Loial, Moiraine and company follow Rand on an increasingly uncertain and deadly path through the snowy mountains seeking that destiny. Egwene, Nynaeve, and Elayne finally return to Tar Valon to find nothing is as they thought it would be. 
NEXT TIME: Chapters 11-15 of The Dragon Reborn
Hosted and produced by Caleb Wimble (@calebwimble), featuring Dan Kutinsky (@panzydan), Keeley Frank (@keeley_reads), and Nick Wicks
Support the show and access special bonus content at: patreon.com/wotcast
Send questions, comments, and corrections to: contact@wotcast.net
Website: wotcast.net | Twitter: @WOTCastPodcast | Facebook: @WOTCastPodcast
Find out more about SOJOURN RPG at www.sojournrpg.net and start playing today!

fields.title: Bonus Episode: Stranger Things (Preview)
fields.description:
Friend of the show Jerry Barney joins us again to discuss Stranger Things and its recently-aired season 4 on Netflix. We talk everything from the history of the show to its grand two-part finale to the promise of more Stranger Things to come. So many theories to unpack and mysteries to unfurl! We lay it all out in this fun-filled conversation.
Hear the full episode over on your private White Tower podcast feed! If you’re not a Patreon subscriber yet, head over to https://www.patreon.com/wotcast to subscribe at the Tar Valon tier or higher and gain access to all our bonus episodes in full.

fields.title: The Great Hunt: Chapters 41-50
fields.description:
It’s all coming to a head. Toman Head, that is! 
Nynaeve frees her friends while turning the tables on their slavers. Rand earns his heron-marked blade and gets marked for all to see as the Dragon Reborn in the process. Mat puts his mouth where no one thought it belonged, and the world will never be the same for it.
The heroes of old return to fight back the Seanchan, and The Great Hunt reaches its dramatic conclusion. 
NEXT TIME: Prologue & Chapters 1-10 of The Dragon Reborn

Hosted and produced by Caleb Wimble (@calebwimble)
Featuring Dan Kutinsky (@panzydan), Keeley Frank (@keeley_reads), and Nick Wicks
Support the show and access special bonus content at: patreon.com/wotcast
Send questions, comments, and corrections to: contact@wotcast.net
Website: wotcast.net | Twitter: @WOTCastPodcast | Facebook: @WOTCastPodcast
Find out more about SOJOURN RPG at www.sojournrpg.net and start playing today!

fields.title: The Great Hunt: Chapters 36-40
fields.description:
Rand, Verin, and the gang take an extracurricular excursion through the multiverse while Liandrin organizes her own furtive field trip for Egwene, Nynaeve, and Elayne. Everyone wishes they’d stayed home today.
NEXT TIME: Chapters 41-50 of The Great Hunt

Hosted and produced by Caleb Wimble (@calebwimble)
Featuring Dan Kutinsky (@panzydan), Keeley Frank (@keeley_reads), and Nick Wicks
Support the show and access special bonus content at: patreon.com/wotcast
Send questions, comments, and corrections to: contact@wotcast.net
Website: wotcast.net | Twitter: @WOTCastPodcast | Facebook: @WOTCastPodcast
Find out more about SOJOURN RPG at www.sojournrpg.net and start playing today!

fields.title: The Great Hunt: Chapters 31-35
fields.description:
Darkfriends abound at the midnight masquerade in a dangerously powerful lord’s manor. Rand and reunited company attempt an escape through the Ways only to find even darker things await them.
NEXT TIME: Chapters 36-40 of The Great Hunt

Hosted and produced by Caleb Wimble (@calebwimble)
Featuring Dan Kutinsky (@panzydan), Keeley Frank (@keeley_reads), and Nick Wicks
Support the show and access special bonus content at: patreon.com/wotcast
Send questions, comments, and corrections to: contact@wotcast.net
Website: wotcast.net | Twitter: @WOTCastPodcast | Facebook: @WOTCastPodcast

fields.title: The Great Hunt: Chapters 26-30
fields.description:
Cue the Yakety Sax: it’s time for a wack-wack-wacky chase sequence through the cra-ra-razy streets of Cairhien! Long-time friend/guest of the show Nick Wicks joins us as first-time co-host to talk Rand and co’s wild interactions with the great game of houses.
NEXT TIME: Chapters 31-35 of The Great Hunt

Hosted and produced by Caleb Wimble (@calebwimble)
Featuring Dan Kutinsky (@panzydan), Keeley Frank (@keeley_reads), and Nick Wicks
Support the show and access special bonus content at: patreon.com/wotcast
Send questions, comments, and corrections to: contact@wotcast.net
Website: wotcast.net | Twitter: @WOTCastPodcast | Facebook: @WOTCastPodcast

fields.title: The Great Hunt: Chapters 21-25
fields.description:
This week, Moiraine retreats to the country for a cozy book mystery turned monster story. Nynaeve undergoes the deadly testing to become Accepted, Egwene meets Elayne meets Min, and Rand finds himself at the center of the tangled political web that is the Cairhienan Game of Houses.
NEXT TIME: Chapters 26-30 of The Great Hunt

Hosted and produced by Caleb Wimble (@calebwimble)
Featuring Dan Kutinsky (@panzydan) and Keeley Frank (@keeley_reads)
Support the show and access special bonus content at: patreon.com/wotcast
Send questions, comments, and corrections to: contact@wotcast.net
Website: wotcast.net | Twitter: @WOTCastPodcast | Facebook: @WOTCastPodcast

fields.title: The Great Hunt: Chapters 16-20
fields.description:
Nynaeve and Egwene receive their first lesson at the school of hard knocks. Rand continues to insist Perrin would know what to do in his situation. No one listens to Loial.
Just what do One Punch Man and Pokémon have to do with all this? Well, there’s only one way to find out.
NEXT TIME: Chapters 21-25 of The Great Hunt

Hosted and produced by Caleb Wimble (@calebwimble)
Featuring Dan Kutinsky (@panzydan) and Keeley Frank (@keeley_reads)
Support the show and access special bonus content at: patreon.com/wotcast
Send questions, comments, and corrections to: contact@wotcast.net
Website: wotcast.net | Twitter: @WOTCastPodcast | Facebook: @WOTCastPodcast

fields.title: The Great Hunt: Chapters 11-15
fields.description:
What weird wonders wait in the woody wild of the worlds that might have been? Things get twisty for Rand, Loial, and Hurin in a parallel dimension right as they get real twisted for Perrin and Mat back in “reality.” Padan Fain’s trail of carnage continues.
As for us? Well, we’re just having a grand ol’ time seeing our girl Verin again. That is, when we’re not debating how damn big that Horn of Valere might be.
NEXT TIME: Chapters 16-20 of The Great Hunt

Hosted and produced by Caleb Wimble (@calebwimble)
Featuring Dan Kutinsky (@panzydan) and Keeley Frank (@keeley_reads)
Support the show and access special bonus content at: patreon.com/wotcast
Send questions, comments, and corrections to: contact@wotcast.net
Website: wotcast.net | Twitter: @WOTCastPodcast | Facebook: @WOTCastPodcast

fields.title: The Great Hunt: Prologue and Chapters 1-10
fields.description:
We are BACK after a holiday hiatus! And we’re fresh and excited to dig into book 2 of The Wheel of Time, The Great Hunt. And boy is a lot happening fast this time compared with the series’ first novel.
Dark times have come to the fortress city of Fal Dara: the legendary Horn of Valere has been stolen, and our party has split in half on the dangerous road to retrieve it. Rand’s secret is out to more people—most notable among them the Amyrlin Seat herself. We learn a great deal more about Aes Sedai politics and the rifts growing among the Ajahs. And we discover that there are far worse things waiting in the wings than shadowspawn and darkfriends.
NEXT TIME: Chapters 11-15 of The Great Hunt

Hosted and produced by Caleb Wimble (@calebwimble)
Featuring Dan Kutinsky (@panzydan) and Keeley Frank (@keeley_reads)
Support the show and access special bonus content at: patreon.com/wotcast
Send questions, comments, and corrections to: contact@wotcast.net
Website: wotcast.net | Twitter: @WOTCastPodcast | Facebook: @WOTCastPodcast

fields.title: PREVIEW — The Witcher (Bonusode)
fields.description:
BONUSODE Preview:
Friend of the show Jerry Barney joins Caleb and Keeley to talk The Witcher in all its incarnations—most recently season 2 of the Netflix series. Whether you’re a long-time Witcher vet or new to the world of Geralt’s monster-slaying, this bonus episode has something to sink your teeth into. 
Hear the full episode over on your private White Tower podcast feed! If you’re not a Patreon subscriber yet, head over to https://www.patreon.com/wotcast to subscribe at the Tar Valon tier or higher and gain access to all our bonus episodes in full.

fields.title: Friends of the Show — Two Friends Watch The Witcher: Nightmare of the Wolf
fields.description:
Leshies and witchers and wood elves, oh my! Caleb guests on this episode of the wonderful Two Friends Watch podcast to talk The Witcher: Nightmare of the Wolf with Daniel and Andrew. We have a great time digging into Witcher lore, the Netflix animation pipeline, and what it means to craft a story that straddles the line between prequel, standalone film, and adaptation of an adaptation.
Find all the great episodes Daniel and Andrew have recorded over the years at https://twofriendswatch.libsyn.com/

fields.title: The Wheel of Time: Episode 8
fields.description:
This is not the ending of The Wheel of Time TV series, but it is an ending. Specifically the ending of Season 1. And hoo boy, what an ending it is! Rand faces off against Ba’alzamon himself as an army of shadowspawn bears down upon his friends and the people of Far Dara. Battles rage, lives are lost, and choices are made that will determine the fate of this world.
Friend of the show Nick Wicks joins our full house to talk the climax and some of our wildest diversions from the books yet. We reflect on the season as a whole, our upcoming holiday break, and our hopes for the series’ future. 
NEXT TIME: Prologue and Chapters 1-5 of The Great Hunt

Hosted and produced by Caleb Wimble (@calebwimble)
Featuring Catie Jarvis (catiejarvis.com), Dan Kutinsky (@panzydan), and Keeley Frank (@keeley_reads)
Support the show and access special bonus content at: patreon.com/wotcast
Send questions, comments, and corrections to: contact@wotcast.net
Website: wotcast.net | Twitter: @WOTCastPodcast | Facebook: @WOTCastPodcast

fields.title: The Wheel of Time: Episode 7
fields.description:
We travel “The Dark Along the Ways” in this, The Wheel of Time’s penultimate season 1 episode. The party reaches Fal Dara on the edge of the Blight and are forced to confront their darkest fears. Secrets are kept, confessions are made, and at long last our Dragon Reborn is revealed!
Friends of the show Andrew and Eric join Caleb and Dan in excited debate about where all this is headed. Laughs abound and controlled chaos ensues when we dig into our grand finale theories and our reflections on the journey WOT and WOTCast have taken.
NEXT TIME: Episode 8 of The Wheel of Time

Hosted and produced by Caleb Wimble (@calebwimble)
Featuring Catie Jarvis (catiejarvis.com), Dan Kutinsky (@panzydan), and Keeley Frank (@keeley_reads)
Support the show and access special bonus content at: patreon.com/wotcast
Send questions, comments, and corrections to: contact@wotcast.net
Website: wotcast.net | Twitter: @WOTCastPodcast | Facebook: @WOTCastPodcast

fields.title: The Eye of the World: Chapters 46-53
fields.description:
At long last, we reach the Blight and the shadow of Shayol Ghul. THIS IS IT: the climax of The Eye of the World, the reveal of the Dragon Reborn, and the close of our first Wheel of Time novel! And boy is there a lot to talk about here in our biggest WOTCast episode yet.
We unpack our surprises, our frustrations, our curiosity over lingering mysteries, and our excitement for what comes next. This is, after all, not the ending; it is only an ending.
NEXT TIME: Episode 7 of The Wheel of Time

Hosted and produced by Caleb Wimble (@calebwimble)
Featuring Catie Jarvis (catiejarvis.com), Dan Kutinsky (@panzydan), and Keeley Frank (@keeley_reads)
Support the show and access special bonus content at: patreon.com/wotcast
Send questions, comments, and corrections to: contact@wotcast.net
Website: wotcast.net | Twitter: @WOTCastPodcast | Facebook: @WOTCastPodcast

fields.title: The Wheel of Time: Episode 6
fields.description:
Friend of the show Nick Wicks joins Caleb and Keeley to talk The Wheel of Time episode 6: The Flame of Tar Valon. And what a flame it is! Moiraine takes us on a whirlwind tour of the White Tower and its dangers as she reunites the party, rescues Mat from the infection of the dagger, and faces judgment from the very person she loves most.
Yet Moiraine’s time in Tar Valon doesn’t last long. The Wheel turns, and ultimate need drives her and the party to the edge of the world on a desperate bid to seal away the Dark One before it’s too late.
NEXT TIME: Chapters 46-53 of The Eye of the World (end of book) and Episode 7 of The Wheel of Time

Hosted and produced by Caleb Wimble (@calebwimble)
Featuring Catie Jarvis (catiejarvis.com), Dan Kutinsky (@panzydan), and Keeley Frank (@keeley_reads)
Support the show and access special bonus content at: patreon.com/wotcast
Send questions, comments, and corrections to: contact@wotcast.net
Website: wotcast.net | Twitter: @WOTCastPodcast | Facebook: @WOTCastPodcast

fields.title: The Eye of the World: Chapters 41-45
fields.description:
United at last, the party prepares to flee Caemlyn as an army of trollocs and fades bear down upon the city. Moiraine is able to reverse the effect of the dagger’s curse in Mat, but only temporarily; the evil which spreads in him could soon infect the entire world.
And that’s not our only world-ending threat! Turns out the Dark One is just about ready to break free of his prison if the Dragon Reborn doesn’t rush to the Eye of the World before our Big Bad can claim its power. Two problems with that: first, the Eye of the World is very, very far away. Second, we still don’t know which of our ta’veren will be the Dragon.
So it looks like everyone—Loial included—will need to travel together outside time and space through the ancient and extremely cursed Ways.
NEXT TIME: Episode 6 of The Wheel of Time and Chapters 46-53 of The Eye of the World (end of book)

Hosted and produced by Caleb Wimble (@calebwimble)
Featuring Catie Jarvis (catiejarvis.com), Dan Kutinsky (@panzydan), and Keeley Frank (@keeley_reads)
Support the show and access special bonus content at: patreon.com/wotcast
Send questions, comments, and corrections to: contact@wotcast.net
Website: wotcast.net | Twitter: @WOTCastPodcast | Facebook: @WOTCastPodcast

fields.title: The Eye of the World: Chapters 36-40 and The Wheel of Time: Episode 5
fields.description:
While Mat lies dying of doom-laden dagger disease, Rand explores the great city of Caemlyn and meets a colorful cast of characters. Loial the "hotheaded" "young" ogier full of lore, Elayne the daughter-heir of Andor, Elaida the Red, and Queen Morgase herself, just to name a few. Elsewhere, Nynaeve, Lan, and Moiraine launch a daring rescue of Perrin and Egwene from the Whitecloaks. Is our party about to be reunited at last?
Meanwhile, in TV land, forlorn warder Stepin copes with the loss of his bonded Kerene Sedai. Neither of whom are in The Eye of the World, but we presume there's a good reason we're spending one of this season's eight episodes on this subplot! We're just not sure what it is yet.
Nynaeve navigates her first taste of White Tower politics, from which she vows to protect Mat and Rand when they are finally reunited. Alas, poor Egwene and Perrin—captured by Whitecloaks for reasons unclear—have no such protector of their own...or do they?
Content warnings: discussion of torture, suicide, and gore
NEXT TIME: Chapters 41-45 of The Eye of the World and Episode 6 of The Wheel of Time

Hosted and produced by Caleb Wimble (@calebwimble)
Featuring Catie Jarvis (catiejarvis.com), Dan Kutinsky (@panzydan), and Keeley Frank (@keeley_reads)
Support the show and access special bonus content at: patreon.com/wotcast
Send questions, comments, and corrections to: contact@wotcast.net
Website: wotcast.net | Twitter: @WOTCastPodcast | Facebook: @WOTCastPodcast

fields.title: The Wheel of Time: Episodes 3-4
fields.description:
Friend of the show Nicholas Wicks joins Caleb and Keeley this Thanksgiving weekend to talk the latest two episodes of The Wheel of Time. And we are hot to talk about the big changes brought to the source material by Episode 3: "A Place of Safety" and Episode 4: "The Dragon Reborn"!
Nynaeve rejoins the fray, Moiraine confronts the self-proclaimed Dragon Logain, Perrin and Egwene learn the story behind the Tuatha'an's Way of the Leaf, and Thom leads an increasingly disturbed Mat and Rand on the run for their lives.
No book talk this episode! We'll resume our regularly scheduled The Eye of the World chapters next time when we're all back from holiday travel.
Content warnings: suicide, child murder
NEXT TIME: Chapters 36-40 of The Eye of the World and Episode 5 of The Wheel of Time

Hosted and produced by Caleb Wimble (@calebwimble)
Featuring Catie Jarvis (catiejarvis.com), Dan Kutinsky (@panzydan), and Keeley Frank (@keeley_reads)
Support the show and access special bonus content at: patreon.com/wotcast
Send questions, comments, and corrections to: contact@wotcast.net
Website: wotcast.net | Twitter: @WOTCastPodcast | Facebook: @WOTCastPodcast

fields.title: The Wheel of Time: Episodes 1-2 and The Eye of the World: Chapters 31-35
fields.description:
After decades of waiting and failures to launch, THE WHEEL OF TIME adapted series has premiered, with the first batch of episodes live on Amazon Prime! But was it worth the wait? We watch the first two episodes to find out. 
Meanwhile on the page, Rand and Mat's perilous journey to Caemlyn continues in chapters 31-35 of The Eye of the World. Darkfriend after darkfriend hunts for them as Rand grows more desperate and Mat spirals into paranoia. Will the great city of Caemlyn offer safety? Or is yet another trap laid along their path by the Dark One and his agents?
ALSO: another bonus episode is live on the White Tower podcast feed for our Tar Valon tier patrons! Head over to our Patreon now to subscribe and hear Part Two of our DUNE discussion.
NEXT TIME: Chapters 36-40 of The Eye of the World and Episodes 3-4 of The Wheel of Time

Hosted and produced by Caleb Wimble (@calebwimble)
Featuring Catie Jarvis (catiejarvis.com), Dan Kutinsky (@panzydan), and Keeley Frank (@keeley_reads)
Support the show and access special bonus content at: patreon.com/wotcast
Send questions, comments, and corrections to: contact@wotcast.net
Website: wotcast.net | Twitter: @WOTCastPodcast | Facebook: @WOTCastPodcast

fields.title: The Eye of the World: Chapters 26-30
fields.description:
Things go from bad to worse for our Two Rivers teens in chapters 26-30 of The Eye of the World. Nynaeve intensifies her search for her charges, Moiraine once again makes harsh choices, and Thom stays behind to proverbially HOLD THE DOOR so that Mat and Rand can escape the Myrddraal. Swarms of the Dark One's beast servants descend on Perrin and Egwene, and after a temporary reprieve they face a more dangerous foe yet in the Lord Captain of the Whitecloaks.
Besides all this adventure, we chat about the resonances of these chapters with Homer's Odyssey and puzzle over some of this novel's allusions to Arthurian legend. What's Jordan up to here, exactly?
We also announce the arrival of our first bonus episode on the secret White Tower podcast feed available only to our Tar Valon tier patrons! Head over to our Patreon now to subscribe and hear our DUNE: Part One bonusode, with Part Two to follow next week on The White Tower.
Content warnings: discussions of gruesome animal violence, bondage, and torture.
NEXT TIME: Chapters 31-35 of The Eye of the World
Hosted and produced by Caleb Wimble (@calebwimble)
Featuring Catie Jarvis (catiejarvis.com), Dan Kutinsky (@panzydan), and Keeley Frank (@keeley_reads)
Support the show and access special bonus content at: patreon.com/wotcast
Send questions, comments, and corrections to: contact@wotcast.net
Website: wotcast.net | Twitter: @WOTCastPodcast | Facebook: @WOTCastPodcast

fields.title: The Eye of the World: Chapters 21-25
fields.description:
In chapters 21-25 of The Eye of the World, we meet the traveling Tuatha'an—also called Tinkers—and discuss the significance of their pacifist Way of the Leaf in a world full of monstrous aggressors. Do the "Lost" children become the Lost because of their, as Keeley puts it, insatiable lust for human blood that can never be satisfied except at the point of a blade? We ask the hard questions here.
Some of us near the end of our patience for the Two Rivers teens and start to wonder where Jordan might be going with these wool-headed shenanigans. Luckily we see some light at the end of the tunnel, thanks to wolf dreams.
NEXT TIME: Chapters 26-30 of The Eye of the World

Hosted and produced by Caleb Wimble (@calebwimble)
Featuring Catie Jarvis (catiejarvis.com), Dan Kutinsky (@panzydan), and Keeley Frank (@keeley_reads)
Support the show and access special bonus content at: patreon.com/wotcast
Send questions, comments, and corrections to: contact@wotcast.net
Website: wotcast.net | Twitter: @WOTCastPodcast | Facebook: @WOTCastPodcast

fields.title: The Eye of the World: Chapters 16-20
fields.description:
Chapters 16-20 of The Eye of the World take us out of Baerlon's frying pan into the fire of Shadar Logoth—a dead city of tempter ghosts and grasping, all-devouring mists. We discuss our enjoyment of these action- and horror-packed chapters...but also our mounting frustration with the three stooges Rand, Mat, and Perrin as they continue to flout common sense and wizardly warnings in favor of messing around with obviously cursed catacombs at midnight.
We also take a detour into the gender politics of the Two Rivers and an interesting factoid about Robert Jordan's relationship with his fictional women. Questions are raised, as are eyebrows.
Content warnings: brief reference to nonconsensual bondage.
NEXT TIME: Chapters 21-25 of The Eye of the World

Hosted and produced by Caleb Wimble (@calebwimble)
Featuring Catie Jarvis (catiejarvis.com), Dan Kutinsky (@panzydan), and Keeley Frank (@keeley_reads)
Support the show and access special bonus content at: patreon.com/wotcast
Send questions, comments, and corrections to: contact@wotcast.net
Website: wotcast.net | Twitter: @WOTCastPodcast | Facebook: @WOTCastPodcast

fields.title: The Eye of the World: Chapters 11-15
fields.description:
This week in Chapters 11-15 of The Eye of the World, we meet our new frenemies the Whitecloaks, learn more about the danger of the "Dragon" Logain, and find out just how far Moiraine Sedai is willing to go to keep her charges away from the Dark One. 
Before that, we discuss Zach Baron's comprehensive GQ exposé on the Wheel of Time TV series production. We also chat about Netflix's hit new dystopian series Squid Game and the short sci-fi story "The Dynasty of Lilith" by Andrew Milne.
Content warnings: discussions of mass shootings and gendered violence.
NEXT TIME: Chapters 16-20 of The Eye of the World

Hosted and produced by Caleb Wimble (@calebwimble)
Featuring Catie Jarvis (catiejarvis.com), Dan Kutinsky (@panzydan), and Keeley Frank (@keeley_reads)
Support the show and access special bonus content at: patreon.com/wotcast
Send questions, comments, and corrections to: contact@wotcast.net
Website: wotcast.net | Twitter: @WOTCastPodcast | Facebook: @WOTCastPodcast

fields.title: The Eye of the World: Chapters 6-10
fields.description:
This week, the action begins! We dive into Chapters 6-10 of The Eye of the World to find the idyllic country life of our Two Rivers crew plunged into violence and chaos. Secrets are revealed, desperate bargains are struck, and our protagonists make decisions that will change the course of their lives. Amidst this all we find some surprising moments of humor. We share our excitement for the direction the plot seems to be going, and we speculate where all these grand reveals might be taking us.
But first, we talk about the other media we've been taking in lately (you can skip ahead to 27:00 to get right to the Wheel of Time talk). Catie shares her viewing experience with Y: The Last Man, a post-apocalyptic show about a plague which wipes out a whole sex, and which may have more to do with WOT than you might guess. Dan is damning with faint praise about the musical series Smash, Caleb is pleasantly surprised by a Matrix trilogy rewatch, and Keeley brings three charming new graphic novels to the table. We even talk Game of Thrones and our various levels of enthusiasm for the new House of the Dragon prequel spin-off trailer  
NEXT TIME: Chapters 11-15 of The Eye of the World
Hosted and produced by Caleb Wimble (@calebwimble)
Featuring Catie Jarvis (catiejarvis.com), Dan Kutinsky (@panzydan), and Keeley Frank (@keeley_reads)
Support the show and access special bonus content at: patreon.com/wotcast
Send questions, comments, and corrections to: contact@wotcast.net
Website: wotcast.net
Twitter: @WOTCastPodcast
Facebook: @WOTCastPodcast

fields.title: The Eye of the World: Prologue and Chapters 1-5
fields.description:
Welcome to WOTCast's inaugural episode! Caleb, Catie, Dan, and Keeley dive head-first into the sprawling fantasy world of Robert Jordan's first Wheel of Time novel, The Eye of the World. 
Join us as we introduce ourselves, a brief history of the series, and the upcoming Amazon adaptation. Then get a close look at the Prologue and Chapters 1-5 of The Eye of the World. We talk about epic worldbuilding in the shadow of Tolkien, the meaning of all this religious symbolism, our thoughts on the (many, many) characters we're introduced to in these chapters, and more! 
NEXT TIME: Chapters 6-10 of The Eye of the World
Hosted and produced by Caleb Wimble (@calebwimble)
Featuring Catie Jarvis (catiejarvis.com), Dan Kutinsky (@panzydan), and Keeley Frank
Support the show and access special bonus content at: patreon.com/wotcast
Send questions, comments, and corrections to: contact@wotcast.net
Website: wotcast.netTwitter: @WOTCastPodcastFacebook: @WOTCastPodcast

fields.title: Ep98: Crossroads of Twilight, Chapters 13 - 15
fields.description: And we're back! Ready to tackle the political intrigue of Andor, as well as the concept of "The Slog". In these chapters Elayne meets the young High Seats of the houses Dyelin has managed to recruit for Elayne's claim to the throne before she gets her reports from her spy-masters-in-all-but-name: Reene Harfour and Halwin Norry! Later she is visited by Monaelle and Sumeko to practice a pregnancy weave and they sense the cleansing event end. We then cut to a rare POV from Elenia Sarand, the cap...

fields.title: Ep97: Crossroads of Twilight, Chapters 9 - 12
fields.description: We're in it now, friends. The stretch of chapters that have alwasy to me represented the concept of the slog. And I'm happy to report, I didn't mind them. But at least one of us has very strong feelings about the chapters and the book, and we explore that with vigor!  We touch base with Faile who is fending off adversity on every front. Then we join Elayne and aviendha as they go about the business of managing the Kin, Windfinders and Aes Sedai. During a siege. While trying to gain suppo...

fields.title: Ep96: Crossroads of Twilight, Chapters 5 - 8
fields.description: And we're back! Albeit with 2 of the three a little under the weather, so brace yourself for some croaky voices at points! But we soldier on, much like Perrin on his unrelenting persuit of his kidnapped wife. There is some good news on that front, but at teh same time Perrin needs to manage his own reputation, the various forces travelling with him, Masema and his army of madmen and to top it all off, a huge pack of 50 darkhounds circling his camp. It's a tough gig, but so far he's keeping it...

fields.title: Ep95: Crossroads of Twilight, Chapters 1 - 4
fields.description: It's our triumphant return after an 8 week break! And we kick off book 10 with a BANG. After working through a healthy amount of listener contributions and callbacks, we join Mat in the aftermath of their escape from Ebou Dar in the confusion caused by the freed Windfinders. Mat must navigate the conflicting priorities and under currents of all his entourage, including Egeanin, Tuon, the Aes Sedai he freed, and of course, Valan Luca. We also get an insightful chapter from Furyk Karede, a down...

fields.title: Ep94: Crossroads of Twilight, Prologue
fields.description: We're back with a brand new book! And this one is already shaping up to be a bit of a test. We're surprisingly divided on the prologue here, which makes for some good conversation. 3h of it!  We're treated to a scattershot of points of view, 7 of them over 80 pages. Rodel Ituralde joins the narrative, we check in with Eamon Valda and the surviving Whitecloaks, Gabrelle is observing a change in Logain, Yukiri is navigating heavy under currents in the White Tower, Gawyn feels cornered, Bashere ...

fields.title: Ep93: Winter's Heart, Chapters 33 - 35
fields.description: It's the big finale! And we mean, BIG. HUGE.  Rand takes care of some unfinished business in Far Madding, but not without a price. By the time the women pull him and Lan out of the coals it's too late, and Rand has taken some more emotional knocks.  But he's all business as he leads the now combined party from Far Madding to everyone's favourite cursed city to perform the single greatest feat of channelling performed in this age. And the Forsaken won't have it! Battles ensue...  Let us know w...

fields.title: Ep92: Winter's Heart, Chapters 28 - 32
fields.description: Too late now for anything but beginning...  Mat and the gang prepare to escape Ebou Dar. They do all the recon, make some plans, then make some new plans, then change those plans in an all action episode!  We also quickly check back in with Rand who is still hunting traitors in Far Madding, and who receives a big tip off on where to find two of them...  Let us know what you think of the episode using the links below: X - @BloodAndAshPodEmail - moritz@bloodandashespodcast.comYouTube - Blood an...

fields.title: Ep91: Winter's Heart, Chapters 24 - 27
fields.description: Welcome back friends!  Join us as we peer over Shallon's shoulder and watch Cadsuane run roughshod over the Far Madding Leadership.   Later it's Rand's turn to be Cadsuaned and he finally has a big chat with Allana.  Verin almost steals the show with a last minute change of plan, but when Merilille returns with news from the Borderlander army Elayne springs into action and negotiates a deal with the 4 rulers to help her claim.  We're getting ready for the big finale!  Let us know what yo...

fields.title: Ep90: Winter's Heart, Chapters 20 - 23
fields.description: Another mixed bag of treats this week with loads of rare POVs!  The Seanchan Seeker, Almurat Mor, makes an appearance and scares the bejsus out of Bethamin, a lame Sul'dam.  She runs to Egeanin who's lounging around with her butler boyfriend and smuggler extraordinaire, Bayle Domon.  We have Rand kicking ass in Far Madding and Padan Fain with a subtle cameo.  And finally we have Cadsuane and an entourage of Aes Sedai and Seafolk show up right outside Far Madding as well. Whooooo, wonder how t...

fields.title: Ep89: Winter's Heart, Chapters 16 - 19
fields.description: It's all happening in Ebou Dar!  Mat's party for the next leg of his journey is taking shape. Alludra, Teslyn, Joline and Tuon are all around him, plus Thom, Juilin, Olver and his closest men from the Band.  Tuon is definitely taking an ineterst in Mat, but Mat can only think of getting out of Ebou Dar and how to squeeze Alludra's secrets from her. Literally.  Oh, and a Gholam tries to kill Mat, only for Jain Farstrider to join his party.  We're gearing up for the great escape from Ebou Dar! ...

fields.title: Ep88: Winter's Heart, Chapters 12 - 15
fields.description: At long last, more rambling!  In this episode Rand is cornered by the women in his life, and made to understand how things will be. Spoiler: Everyone is happy (except Nynaeve)  Cadsuane is doing Cadsuane things, including taking down the Seafolk a peg or two and having Asha'am in civvies serve her mulled wine.  There is a fun little Forsaken gathering with Moridin in fine form.  Tuon arrives! And as if the herald the return of a fan favourite...  ...Mat's back! And healing up in Ebou Dar, try...

fields.title: Ep87: Winter's Heart, Chapters 10 - 11
fields.description: Hello again, and welcome back to "everybody's popping in"!  We join Elayne and her gang shortly after the attempt at her life and get an unexpected but welcome visit from Egwene in Tel'aran'rhiod.   We also get a glimpse of Slayer and a bit of a debrief from the Black Ajah sisters in Caemlyn, and as if that's not dark enough, a check in with Milli Skane and her latest plant, Daved Hanlon.  We then switch to Nynaeve who is having a torrid time with the Windfinders, but another surprise vi...

fields.title: Ep86: Winter's Heart, Chapters 6 - 9
fields.description: And they're off! Perrin finally sets off after Faile but not after having to navigate a tricky PR situation and suffering the Prophet's madness.  Elayne meanwhile has a busy morning. Riding around the city, taking reports, getting changed, dealing with the Kin and the "gift" from Rand, managing Vandene and getting frustrated and inspired by Nynaeve in equal measure, and finally gets forkrooted and attacked. It's tough being the Daughter Heir!  Let us know what we missed by using any of the so...

fields.title: Ep85: Winter's Heart, Chapters 1 - 5
fields.description: Ok, everybody get your scarves and mittens on because we're starting the ol' cold trudge!  Perrin and his entourage leave Abila and the prophet and head back to camp where they find a tense stand off. He learns that Faile has been captured and reacts predictably.  Meanwhile Faile, Alliandre, Maigdin and co are learning what it means to be taken gai'shain, in the snow, on the move. They cross paths with Therava and Sevannah, and regretably, Galina. Immediately plans are made by everyone...  Le...

fields.title: Ep84: Winter's Heart, Prologue
